question.title: Will Glenn Youngkin be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Glenn Youngkin is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Given Larry Elder is the Republican nominee, will Glenn Youngkin also be the nominee?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, is Glenn Youngkin also selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criteria: The question resolves as YES if Glenn Youngkin is indeed selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, despite Larry Elder also being selected. It resolves as NO if Glenn Youngkin is not selected. Note that this scenario is logically inconsistent under typical single-nominee conditions.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The lack of removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is not removed or blocked from a ballot and then removed, such that as of July 15th he is removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be excluded or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially excluded or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The exclusion or prevention must be validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media coverage. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will conclude with a "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This inquiry does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or any subsequent changes that may happen after the specified date. It is strictly focused on whether Donald Trump has been excluded from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the specified conditions as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is excluded or prevented from a ballot and then later reinstated, resulting in him not being excluded or prevented from any ballot as of July 15th, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Donald Trump is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question may take into account new candidates that may emerge in the future.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republicans on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is strictly based on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Given Donald Trump is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will he be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. 

Then, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: Donald Trump must be selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee.
- For the outcome: Resolves "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports.
- The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. The question does not consider legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals after this date.

- For the condition: Donald Trump must be selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee.
- For the outcome: Resolves "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports.
- The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024. The question does not consider legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals after this date.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump is not the Republican candidate, will he be disqualified or prevented from appearing on any primary ballot according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not die before Saturday?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if there is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will pass away before Saturday?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if an official declaration of Joe Biden's death is made before the market closes on Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

not_P.title: Will Biden not remain President through end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he remains President through that time.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a NO resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden still be in office as President by the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This will be determined as YES if Biden is still the US President at the end of July 2024 (ET); it will be NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as the Acting President) does not result in a YES outcome. (An Acting President is not considered the same as President according to the Constitution)

question.title: Conditional on Biden remaining President through end of July 2024, will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). This means he does not resign, die, or otherwise cease to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not affect this condition.

Given this condition, will there be an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th? Resolves YES if such an announcement occurs before this deadline, otherwise resolves NO.

Note: If Biden ceases to be President before the end of July 2024 for any reason other than temporary transfer of power, this question resolves N/A.

not_P.title: Conditional on Biden remaining President through end of July 2024, will Joe Biden not die before Saturday?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). This means he does not resign, die, or otherwise cease to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not affect this condition.

Given this condition, will there be no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th? Resolves YES if such an announcement does not occur before this deadline, otherwise resolves NO.

Note: If Biden ceases to be President before the end of July 2024 for any reason other than temporary transfer of power, this question resolves N/A.

para_P.title: Assuming Biden stays in office until the conclusion of July 2024, will Joe Biden pass away before Saturday?
para_P.body:
Let us consider the following scenario: Biden continues as the President of the United States until the end of July 2024 (Eastern Time). This implies that he neither resigns, dies, nor otherwise stops being President prior to that date. A temporary transfer of authority under the 25th amendment does not change this condition.

Under this premise, will there be a formal declaration of Joe Biden's death before the market closes on Friday, July 26th? The answer will be YES if such a declaration is made before this cutoff, otherwise it will be NO.

Please note: If Biden is no longer President for any reason other than a temporary transfer of power before the end of July 2024, this question will be marked as N/A.

question.title: Conditional on Biden ceasing to be President before the end of July 2024, will Biden die before Saturday?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Biden ceases to be President before the end of July 2024. This could happen if Biden resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be US President before the end of July 2024 (ET); however, a temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not count. Given this, will there be an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th? Resolves YES if such an announcement is made, otherwise resolves NO.

not_P.title: Conditional on Biden ceasing to be President before the end of July 2024, will Biden not die before Saturday?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: Biden ceases to be President before the end of July 2024. This could happen if Biden resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be US President before the end of July 2024 (ET); however, a temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not count. Given this, will there be no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th? Resolves YES if no such announcement is made, otherwise resolves NO.

para_P.title: If Biden is no longer President before the conclusion of July 2024, will he pass away before Saturday?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds true: Biden is no longer in the role of President before the conclusion of July 2024. This could occur if Biden resigns, dies, or otherwise stops being the US President before the end of July 2024 (ET); however, a temporary transfer of authority under the 25th amendment is not considered. In light of this, will there be an official declaration of Joe Biden's death prior to the market closing at the end of Friday, July 26th? Resolves YES if such a declaration occurs, otherwise resolves NO.

para_P.body: Should Biden decide to withdraw or be otherwise incapacitated from continuing his campaign before the clock strikes midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, the outcome will be a no.

question.title: If Biden drops out before July 20, will Kamala Harris be President by July 26?
question.body:

Then, will Vice President Kamala Harris be formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET?

Resolution criteria for condition: Resolves YES if Biden drops out or is unable to continue before July 20 midnight ET. Resolves NO otherwise.
Resolution criteria for outcome: Resolves YES if Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The absence of removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be excluded or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially excluded or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The exclusion or barring must be verified through official state government statements, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reputable media sources. Speculative information, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be sufficient for resolution.

The inquiry will be considered "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may happen after the specified date. It solely focuses on whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state’s primary election ballot for a federal position under the indicated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is excluded or barred from a ballot and later reinstated, resulting in him not being excluded or barred from any ballot as of July 15, the question will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of fewer than 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are met by market close, this market resolves NO.

A letter that has been drafted, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, provides the first public indication from Democrats since the recent assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump that many of their own members remain quite concerned about the prospects of Biden’s candidacy.

“This is a really poor decision by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a smart way to stifle debate and, through sheer force, achieve unity, but that’s not how it functions,” Huffman stated in an interview. He did not confirm the letter's existence.

This market will resolve to YES if a public statement opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who are part of the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Additionally, multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by the market close, this market will resolve to NO.

Context for Q: Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition against their party’s attempt to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination earlier than initially intended. A letter drafted by Rep. Jared Huffman serves as a public indication that many Democrats are concerned about Biden’s candidacy.

Criteria for Q resolution: This will resolve to YES if at least 20 House Members or Senators aligned with the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan before the market closes on Sunday, July 21st. Multiple letters totaling 20 signatures are acceptable. If these conditions are not satisfied by market close, it resolves to NO.

Assuming the following is accurate: 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to withdraw before July 20. Then, will at least 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?

question.title: Given fewer than 10 Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Fewer than 10 Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20. This means that at no point before midnight July 20 Central Time, does the resolution source show 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out.

Then, is the following true? At least 20 House or Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early. This resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES.

If fewer than 10 Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20 and the criteria for the public letter are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

not_P.title: Given fewer than 10 Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, will fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?

This resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of fewer than 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES.

If fewer than 10 Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20 and the criteria for the public letter are met by market close, this market resolves YES.

para_P.title: If fewer than 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to resign prior to July 20, will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the initiative to nominate Biden early?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Less than 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to resign before July 20. This indicates that at no time before midnight July 20 Central Time does the resolution source indicate 10 or more Democratic Senators urging Biden to resign.

Then, is the following valid? A minimum of 20 Democrats from either the House or Senate endorse a public statement opposing the initiative to nominate Biden early. This is resolved as YES if a public statement against the early nomination initiative is endorsed by at least 20 House Members or Senators affiliated with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such statements with a total of 20 lawmakers' endorsements would also be adequate to resolve this market to YES.

If fewer than 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to resign before July 20 and the conditions for the public statement are not satisfied by market close, this market resolves to NO.

question.body:

- The outcome resolves as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is also selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It resolves as **No** if he is not selected.

question.body:

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will a group of fewer than 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators not pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
not_P.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of fewer than five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators do not work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by not signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group not speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals not be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is sufficient for a NO resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving YES. 

If these criteria are met before July 20th, this market resolves YES.

para_P.title: Will a collective of no fewer than five identified Democratic House Representatives or Senators urge Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members in secure districts have already publicly called for Biden to exit the race. Two of the most vulnerable Democrats have indicated to local media that they believe Biden's chances for victory in November are slim.

Behind the scenes, the situation is even more chaotic. There are several drafts of letters being circulated among House Democrats, and at least one letter is expected to request that Biden terminate his campaign, as reported by five sources familiar with the discussions.

This market will resolve to YES if a coalition of at least five identified Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborates to ask Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could take the form of signing a letter as mentioned above, or it might happen through another method, such as a group meeting with Biden in person to collectively request his withdrawal.

For a YES resolution, it is necessary that all five individuals participate in the same group communication. If five individuals independently express to reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw, it will not qualify for a YES outcome.

Any reports regarding an unspecified number of unnamed Democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not meet the criteria for this market unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the market closes. In cases where such names are reported but not confirmed with a high degree of certainty, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not fulfilled by July 20th, this market will resolve to NO.

para_P.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden declare by July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic...nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Will Joe Biden publicly state before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the nomination for President from the Democratic Party?

This resolves in the same manner as the original question on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Criteria for resolution

This question will be marked as Yes if, prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear and official announcement indicating that he will not pursue or accept the Democratic Party's nomination for a second term as President of the United States in the 2024 election.

For a Yes resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the upcoming 2024 election.

If no such clear statement is issued before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be marked as No.

Further details and context can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original question is resolved, its outcome will automatically apply to this market. Users deemed trustworthy are encouraged to resolve this market early if the outcome is known and clear. Feel free to contact @jskf for early resolution requests or to report any issues.

question.title: Given that Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will a group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressure him to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This announcement must be definitive, public, and unambiguous, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination in the 2024 election cycle.

Then, is it true that a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators will work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?

This requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message, such as signing a letter or collectively speaking with Biden. Separate individual statements are insufficient. Furthermore, reports must include the names of at least five individuals, confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, before the market's end date. In ambiguous cases, the resolution will err towards NO.

If these criteria are not met by July 20th, this market resolves NO.

not_P.title: Given that Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic nomination, will a group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators not pressure him to drop out before July 20th?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This announcement must be definitive, public, and unambiguous, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the nomination in the 2024 election cycle.

Then, is it true that a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators will not work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?

This requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message, such as signing a letter or collectively speaking with Biden. Separate individual statements are insufficient. Furthermore, reports must include the names of at least five individuals, confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, before the market's end date. In ambiguous cases, the resolution will err towards YES.

If these criteria are met by July 20th, this market resolves YES.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden makes a public announcement prior to July 15, 2024, stating that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination, will there be a coalition of at least five identified Democratic House Representatives or US Senators who will press him to withdraw from the race before July 20th?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Joe Biden makes a definitive and clear announcement before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not seek the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This statement must leave no doubt about his intention to not accept the nomination in the upcoming 2024 election.

Then, can we ascertain whether a coalition of at least five identified Democratic Party US House Representatives or US Senators will unite to persuade Joe Biden to consider ending his campaign for re-election in 2024, or to actively encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?

It is essential that all five members are part of a single group communication, such as co-signing a letter or speaking jointly with Biden. Individual statements made separately will not suffice. Additionally, reports must list the names of at least five individuals, confirmed with a high degree of certainty, before the market's closing date. In cases of uncertainty, the resolution will lean towards NO.

If these conditions are not fulfilled by July 20th, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden not announcing before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will a group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressure him to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden does not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This means that prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, neither Joe Biden nor his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement declaring that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

Then, is it true that a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?

The group must be cohesive, meaning that they must be part of the same group message, such as signing a letter or collectively speaking with Biden. Five people separately expressing their opinion is not sufficient. The names of the individuals must be made public, and if there is ambiguity, the resolution errs towards NO. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, the resolution is NO.

not_P.title: Conditional on Joe Biden not announcing before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will a group of fewer than 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators not pressure him to drop out before July 20th?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden does not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This means that prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, neither Joe Biden nor his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement declaring that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

Then, is it true that a group of fewer than five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators do not work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?

The group must be cohesive, meaning that they must be part of the same group message, such as signing a letter or collectively speaking with Biden. Five people separately expressing their opinion is not sufficient. The names of the individuals must be made public, and if there is ambiguity, the resolution errs towards YES. If these criteria are met before July 20th, the resolution is YES.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden has not declared by July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination, will a coalition of at least five identified Democratic House Representatives or US Senators pressure him to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: Joe Biden fails to announce prior to July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This implies that before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, neither Joe Biden nor his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

Then, is it the case that a coalition of at least five identified Democratic Party US House Representatives or US Senators collaborate to request that Joe Biden consider ending his 2024 re-election efforts, or to strongly encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?

The coalition must be unified, meaning they must engage in a single group communication, such as signing a letter or collectively addressing Biden. Five individuals expressing their views independently is not adequate. The identities of the individuals must be disclosed, and in cases of uncertainty, the answer defaults to NO. If these conditions are not fulfilled before July 20th, the answer is NO.

question.body:
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

not_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT not be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
not_P.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is not generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If available in certain EU countries, or available to (for example) minors, this will still resolve negatively, assuming at least >50% of the population cannot use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves negatively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially different (not entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will ChatGPT from OpenAI be accessible to the general public in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to the general public in the EU by June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

"Accessible to the general public" means that the default situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without needing a VPN (possibly requiring a subscription). If it is not available in certain EU nations (similar to the situation in Italy in early 2023), or if it is not accessible to specific groups (such as minors), the question will still be answered positively, provided that more than 50% of the population can access it.

"ChatGPT" in this context refers to the standard web interface (not the API) used for engaging with GPT models. The question will still be answered positively if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (submitting queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will Latvia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Latvia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Latvia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Latvia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Latvia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Latvia qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Latvia going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Latvia competes in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Latvia fails to qualify, the inquiry will resolve with a **No**.

question.title: Will Belgium qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Belgium participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If not, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Belgium not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Belgium does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If so, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Belgium set to make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Belgium competes in a Semi-final and is formally recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Otherwise, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Belgium qualifying for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will Latvia also qualify?
question.body:
This question explores the conditional outcome of Latvia's qualification based on Belgium's performance. 

Suppose the following is true: Belgium participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. 

Then, will Latvia also qualify for the Grand Final? Latvia needs to participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final for this to resolve as Yes. If Latvia does not qualify, the question will resolve as No.

not_P.title: Conditional on Belgium qualifying for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will Latvia not qualify?
not_P.body:
This question explores the conditional outcome of Latvia's qualification based on Belgium's performance. 

Suppose the following is true: Belgium participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. 

Then, will Latvia not qualify for the Grand Final? Latvia needs to participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final for this to resolve as Yes. If Latvia does qualify, the question will resolve as No.

para_P.title: If Belgium secures a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will Latvia secure a spot as well?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the outcome of Latvia's qualification contingent upon Belgium's success. 

Assuming the following holds true: Belgium competes in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. 

In that case, will Latvia also achieve qualification for the Grand Final? Latvia must compete in a Semi-final and be confirmed by the EBU as qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final for the answer to be Yes. If Latvia fails to qualify, the answer will be No.

question.title: Given Belgium fails to qualify, will Latvia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Belgium participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Latvia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

Resolution criteria:
- For Belgium: Resolves Yes if Belgium fails to qualify as per the official announcement by the EBU.
- For Latvia: Resolves Yes if Latvia qualifies for the Grand Final as per the official announcement by the EBU. Resolves No otherwise.

not_P.title: Given Belgium fails to qualify, will Latvia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Belgium participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Latvia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

Resolution criteria:
- For Belgium: Resolves Yes if Belgium fails to qualify as per the official announcement by the EBU.
- For Latvia: Resolves Yes if Latvia does not qualify for the Grand Final as per the official announcement by the EBU. Resolves No otherwise.

para_P.title: If Belgium does not make it, can Latvia secure a spot in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Belgium takes part in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, can Latvia secure a place in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?

Resolution criteria:
- For Belgium: Resolves Yes if Belgium does not qualify according to the official announcement from the EBU.
- For Latvia: Resolves Yes if Latvia secures a spot in the Grand Final based on the official announcement from the EBU. Resolves No otherwise.

question.title: Given Luxembourg qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will Ireland also qualify?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Luxembourg participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Ireland, having participated in a Semi-final, also be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?

not_P.title: Given Luxembourg qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will Ireland not qualify?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: Luxembourg participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Ireland, having participated in a Semi-final, also not be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?

para_P.title: If Luxembourg secures a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will Ireland achieve the same?
para_P.body: Assuming the following is accurate: Luxembourg takes part in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. In that case, will Ireland, which also competes in a Semi-final, be confirmed by the EBU as qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?

question.title: Given Luxembourg fails to qualify for the Grand Final, will Ireland qualify for Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Luxembourg does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Ireland qualify for the Grand Final?

Resolution criteria for Ireland qualifying: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Ireland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Given Luxembourg qualifies for the Grand Final, will Ireland not qualify for Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Luxembourg participates in a Semi-final or is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Ireland not qualify for the Grand Final?

Resolution criteria for Ireland qualifying: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ireland does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Ireland qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: If Luxembourg does not make it to the Grand Final, can Ireland secure a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Luxembourg is either absent from a Semi-final or has not been officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. In that case, can Ireland secure a place in the Grand Final?

Criteria for Ireland's qualification: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if Ireland competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Ireland fails to qualify, the inquiry will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not die before Saturday?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if there is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will pass away before Saturday?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if there is a formal declaration of Joe Biden's passing prior to the market's closure on Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

question.title: Will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman?
question.body:
Will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

Will resolve “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

not_P.title: Will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee not be a Woman?
not_P.body:
Will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

Will resolve “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the Democratic Party's nominee for the presidency in 2024 will be a woman?
para_P.body:
This will be affirmed with a "yes" when a female candidate is chosen by the Democratic delegates as the presidential nominee for the upcoming election in 2024.

Conversely, it will be denied with a "no" when a male candidate is selected by the Democratic delegates for the presidential nomination in 2024.

question.title: Given the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee is a Woman, will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. Given this, will there be an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th? 

Resolution criteria: 
1. The condition is met if the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. 
2. The outcome resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, it resolves NO.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

not_P.title: Given the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee is a Woman, will Joe Biden not die before Saturday?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. Given this, will there be no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th? 

Resolution criteria: 
1. The condition is met if the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. 
2. The outcome resolves YES if there is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, it resolves NO.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: Assuming the 2024 Democratic Presidential Candidate is a Woman, will there be an announcement of Joe Biden's death prior to Saturday?
para_P.body:
Let’s consider this scenario: The Democratic delegates choose a woman as their presidential candidate for the 2024 election. In this case, will there be an official declaration of Joe Biden's death before the market closes on Friday, July 26th? 

Criteria for resolution: 
1. This condition is satisfied if the Democratic delegates nominate a woman for the presidential election in 2024. 
2. The outcome is considered YES if there is an official announcement regarding Joe Biden's death before the market closure on Friday, July 26th. If not, it will be NO.

If the condition is not satisfied, the question will be marked as N/A.

question.title: Conditional on the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee being a man, will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election, and there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Will resolve “no” if either the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election or there is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. If the condition about the Democratic nominee is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

not_P.title: Conditional on the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee being a man, will Joe Biden not die before Saturday?
not_P.body:
Will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election, and there is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Will resolve “no” if either the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election or there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. If the condition about the Democratic nominee is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: Assuming the 2024 Democratic Presidential Candidate is male, will Joe Biden pass away before Saturday?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a “yes” if the Democratic delegates choose a male candidate for the 2024 election, and there is an official declaration of Joe Biden's death prior to the market closing on Friday, July 26th. 

It will be marked as “no” if the Democratic delegates nominate a female candidate for the 2024 election, or if there is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before the market closes on Friday, July 26th. If the condition regarding the Democratic nominee is not satisfied, the question will be marked as N/A.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if, after the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, reliable reports emerge indicating that an assault ascribed to Israel and taking place within the territory of Iran has resulted in the fatalities of no less than five people.

question.title: If Iran's Guardian Council approves Ahmadinejad as a presidential candidate, will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Iran's Guardian Council includes Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name on its list of approved candidates for president of Iran. This means that Ahmadinejad is included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of qualified presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential election.

Then, we want to know if Israel will carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024. This resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Iran's Guardian Council has added Mahmoud Ahmadinejad to its roster of authorized candidates for the presidency of Iran. This implies that Ahmadinejad is recognized as one of the eligible candidates for the forthcoming presidential election in Iran.

We then seek to determine whether Israel will conduct a lethal operation within Iran before May 1, 2024. This will be considered **Yes** if, after the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, credible sources report an attack attributed to Israel taking place inside Iran that results in the deaths of at least five people.

para_P.body:

Then, is it also accurate to say: Before May 1, 2024, there are trustworthy accounts suggesting that an assault linked to Israel, occurring within the territory of Iran, has resulted in the fatalities of at least five people?

question.title: Will Deadpool & Wolverine have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie? [ahead of Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
question.body:
Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

"""

[image]The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will the new movie top these marks? It will probably be close...

It will certainly play at more theaters... Deadpool was a smash hit at the time, and a bit surprising.

Since BoxOfficeMojo is a bit weird on reporting international opening weekends -- it provides the raw numbers but aggregates them weirdly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to let us know what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is <=$284.5M internationally... this weekend
