The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

Will the new movie top these marks? It will probably be close...

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> OR the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release

Suppose the above is true. Then, will Taylor Swift not cameo in Deadpool and Wolverine?

Resolves YES if she does not appear in the movie in any role, even if it is just her voice used for a character. Will still resolve YES if she is credited on IMDB, if it is still confirmed by independent sources.

para_P.title: Since the opening weekend for Deadpool & Wolverine isn't the highest ever for an R-rated film, will Taylor Swift make a cameo in it?
para_P.body:
Experts are anticipating a massive opening weekend for the "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover film.

Directed by Shawn Levy and featuring Ryan Reynolds, the movie is expected to generate between $340 million and $360 million worldwide in its debut weekend. This would establish the record for the largest opening weekend for an R-rated film. In the domestic market, the film is forecasted to launch with $160 million to $170 million, making it the highest R-rated opening of all time.

The current record for the largest opening weekend for an R-rated film is held by the original Deadpool at $284.5 million ($152.2 million domestically).

Will this new film surpass these figures? It seems it will be very close...

To clarify the resolution...
-> this market will resolve to YES if Deadpool x Wolverine earns $284.5 million or less worldwide during its opening weekend based on reports
-> OR if a reputable publication like the Hollywood Reporter does not acknowledge it as the record for an R-rated movie release

Assuming the above is accurate. Will Taylor Swift make a cameo in Deadpool and Wolverine?

It resolves to YES if she features in the film in any capacity, even if it's just her voice for a character. It will still resolve YES if she is not credited on IMDB, as long as it is confirmed by independent sources.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

not_P.title: Will Biden not drop out before July 20?
not_P.body: If Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Biden will withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body: Should Biden withdraw or be otherwise incapacitated to continue his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will be deemed a yes. If he does not, the market will be considered a no.

question.title: Will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Will Hurd not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Will Hurd going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Will Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is open to additional candidates being considered in the future.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who is nominated as the Republican candidate on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is solely based on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Conditional on Will Hurd being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body:
This question explores the scenario where Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Given this scenario, we are interested in whether Biden will drop out or be unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time.

Resolution criteria for the condition: Will Hurd is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time.

not_P.title: Conditional on Will Hurd being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Biden not drop out before July 20?
not_P.body:
This question explores the scenario where Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Given this scenario, we are interested in whether Biden will not drop out or be able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time.

Resolution criteria for the condition: Will Hurd is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time.

para_P.title: Assuming Will Hurd becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Biden withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the situation in which Will Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Under this condition, we seek to determine if Biden will withdraw or be unable to proceed in the election before July 20 at midnight Eastern Time.

Criteria for the condition: Will Hurd is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Criteria for the outcome: Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to proceed in the election before July 20 at midnight Eastern Time.

question.title: Given that Will Hurd is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Will Hurd is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This means any other candidate is selected as the nominee by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Then, is it true that Biden will drop out or be otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time? If Biden drops out or is unable to continue before this date and time, the outcome resolves as Yes. Otherwise, it resolves as No.

not_P.title: Given that Will Hurd is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Biden not drop out before July 20?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Will Hurd is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This means any other candidate is selected as the nominee by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Then, is it true that Biden will not drop out and will be able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time? If Biden does not drop out and is able to continue before this date and time, the outcome resolves as Yes. Otherwise, it resolves as No.

para_P.title: Assuming Will Hurd is not the chosen Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Biden withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body:
Let us consider this scenario: Will Hurd is not chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This implies that some other individual has been selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee.

In this case, is it accurate to say that Biden will withdraw or be otherwise unable to continue his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20? If Biden withdraws or cannot continue before this specified date and time, the outcome will be Yes. If not, it will be No.

question.title: Will OpenAI publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, OpenAI publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

not_P.title: Will OpenAI not publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, OpenAI does not publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Is it expected that OpenAI will release a public report detailing the outcomes from external red-teaming of their models regarding safety before June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **YES** if OpenAI issues a *public* report by June 30, 2024, that includes findings from an *external* entity assessing the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Will Anthropic publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, Anthropic publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

not_P.title: Will Anthropic not publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, Anthropic does not publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Is it expected that Anthropic will release a report detailing findings from independent red-teaming of their models for safety before June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **YES** if, prior to June 30, 2024, Anthropic issues a *public* report containing the findings from an *external* entity that has conducted red-teaming on the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Given Anthropic publishes a report with external red-teaming results by June 30, 2024, will OpenAI do the same?
question.body:
This question explores whether OpenAI will publish a public report with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024, given that Anthropic does so by that date. 

Resolution criteria for the condition (P): The condition is satisfied if, by June 30, 2024, Anthropic publishes a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

Resolution criteria for the outcome (Q): Resolves YES if, by June 30, 2024, OpenAI publishes a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models. Resolves NO otherwise. If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

not_P.title: Given Anthropic does not publish a report with external red-teaming results by June 30, 2024, will OpenAI not do the same?
not_P.body:
This question explores whether OpenAI will not publish a public report with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024, given that Anthropic does not do so by that date. 

Resolution criteria for the condition (P): The condition is satisfied if, by June 30, 2024, Anthropic does not publish a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

Resolution criteria for the outcome (Q): Resolves YES if, by June 30, 2024, OpenAI does not publish a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models. Resolves NO otherwise. If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

para_P.title: If Anthropic releases a report featuring external red-teaming findings by June 30, 2024, will OpenAI follow suit?
para_P.body:
This inquiry investigates whether OpenAI will issue a public report detailing the results from an external party that red-teamed the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024, contingent upon Anthropic doing so by that deadline. 

Criteria for determining the condition (P): The condition is deemed fulfilled if, by June 30, 2024, Anthropic releases a public report containing the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

Criteria for determining the outcome (Q): Resolves to YES if, by June 30, 2024, OpenAI publishes a public report with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models. Resolves to NO otherwise. If the condition is unmet, resolves to N/A.

question.title: If Anthropic does not publish a report with results from external red-teaming by June 30, 2024, will OpenAI publish such a report?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By June 30, 2024, Anthropic does not publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models. Then, will OpenAI publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by the same date? 

Resolution criteria for the condition: The condition is met if Anthropic does not publish the specified report by June 30, 2024.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if OpenAI publishes the specified report by June 30, 2024. Resolves NO otherwise.
If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

not_P.title: If Anthropic publishes a report with results from external red-teaming by June 30, 2024, will OpenAI not publish such a report?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: By June 30, 2024, Anthropic publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models. Then, will OpenAI not publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by the same date? 

Resolution criteria for the condition: The condition is met if Anthropic publishes the specified report by June 30, 2024.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if OpenAI does not publish the specified report by June 30, 2024. Resolves NO otherwise.
If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

para_P.title: Should OpenAI release a report if Anthropic fails to share external red-teaming results by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: By June 30, 2024, Anthropic has not issued a *public* report detailing the findings from an *external* assessment of the safety of one of their AI models. In this case, will OpenAI provide a *public* report with the findings from an *external* assessment of the safety of one of their AI models by the same deadline? 

Criteria for the condition: The condition is satisfied if Anthropic does not release the specified report by June 30, 2024.
Criteria for the outcome: Resolves to YES if OpenAI issues the specified report by June 30, 2024. Resolves to NO if not. If the condition is not satisfied, resolves to N/A.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

not_P.title: Will Biden not remain President through end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he remains President through that time.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden continue to hold the presidency until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with YES if Biden is still the President of the United States at the end of July 2024 (ET); it will be answered with NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date.

A temporary handover of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not lead to a YES answer, as an Acting President is not considered the same as the President according to the Constitution.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The lack of removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is removed or blocked from a ballot, the question resolves positively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be taken off or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially taken off or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The confirmation of removal or prevention must come from official state government announcements, court rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media reports. Speculative information, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

This question will be regarded as "No" if these conditions are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may occur after the specified date. It exclusively addresses whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or prevented from a ballot and then later reinstated, resulting in him not being removed or blocked from any ballot as of July 15th, the question will resolve negatively.

question.title: Given Donald Trump is removed or blocked from a primary election ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will Biden remain President through July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements do not suffice for resolution. The question strictly pertains to whether Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the condition is not met.

Then, is it true that Biden will remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET)? This resolves YES if Biden remains President through the end of July 2024. It resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a NO resolution, as Acting President is different from President under the Constitution.

not_P.title: Given Donald Trump is not removed and not blocked from a primary election ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will Biden not remain President through July 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements do not suffice for resolution. The question strictly pertains to whether Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is not removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the condition is not met.

Then, is it true that Biden will not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET)? This resolves YES if Biden does not remain President through the end of July 2024. It resolves NO if he remains President through the end of July 2024.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump is disqualified or barred from participating in a primary election due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will Biden continue as President until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Assume the following scenario: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This must be validated through official state government announcements, judicial rulings, legal documents, or credible news reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial communications do not qualify for resolution. The inquiry specifically addresses whether Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot but later reinstated, meaning that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or barred from any ballot, the condition is not fulfilled.

Consequently, is it accurate to say that Biden will remain the President of the United States until the conclusion of July 2024 (ET)? This will be answered with YES if Biden is still President at the end of July 2024. It will be answered with NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that time. A temporary transfer of authority under the 25th amendment (which makes his Vice President the Acting President) does not lead to a NO answer, as Acting President is distinct from President according to the Constitution.

question.title: Conditional on Donald Trump not being removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will Biden remain President through the end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. This is confirmed by the lack of official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports indicating such a removal or block.

Then is it true that Biden will remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET)? This resolves YES if Biden remains President through that time, and NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not affect this resolution.

not_P.title: Conditional on Donald Trump being removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will Biden not remain President through the end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. This is confirmed by official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports indicating such a removal or block.

Then is it true that Biden will not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET)? This resolves YES if Biden resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then, and NO if he remains President through that time. A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not affect this resolution.

para_P.title: Assuming Donald Trump is not disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will Biden continue to be President until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Consider this scenario: As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot for a federal position in any U.S. state based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This is validated by the absence of official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable news sources indicating any disqualification or prevention.

In this case, is it accurate to say that Biden will still be the President of the United States until the end of July 2024 (ET)? The answer is YES if Biden is still in office at that time, and NO if he has resigned, passed away, or otherwise stopped being President before that date. A temporary power transfer under the 25th Amendment does not influence this conclusion.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden be more than 2 but not exceed 3 according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In the context of this question, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies that Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would represent a positive figure of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, and official statement indicating that he will not seek or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any doubt regarding Biden's acceptance of the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: If Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination before July 15, 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden announces before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. The announcement must be definitive, public, official, unambiguous, and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3? This is based on the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

question.title: Will Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make a public announcement before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear and public statement confirming that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear announcement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast dated July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will result in a “No” if Donald Trump is deemed to have a superior probability of winning the US presidential election over Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Should Biden and Trump have identical probabilities, the market will resolve at 50-50.

The source for this resolution will be the FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, accessible at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, particularly the data represented by the blue and red trend lines for the specified resolution date. Any alterations in the methodology used by FiveThirtyEight to compute its figures will not affect the outcome of this market.

The market will resolve based on the data for July 19 as soon as the figures for July 20 are made available. It is possible that the market may not resolve until the data for July 20 is accessible. If no data for July 19 is available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the closest previous figures to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution pertains to the winning probabilities of each candidate expressed as a number out of 100, reported to one decimal place (e.g., “Trump 57 times out of 100”). The number of simulations out of 1,000 that each candidate has won will not be taken into account.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

not_P.title: Will Biden not remain President through end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he remains President until then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a NO resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden serve as President until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Determines YES if Biden is still the US President by the end of July 2024 (ET); determines NO if he steps down, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as designating his Vice President as the Acting President) does not result in a YES determination. (An Acting President is not the same as the President according to the Constitution)

question.title: If Biden remains President through the end of July 2024, will Kamala Harris be President or Acting President by July 26, 2024?
question.body:

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution).

question.body:
This question resolves as No if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, voleyball and water polo.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if fewer than five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that fewer than five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question resolves Yes if, on July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

para_P.title: If fewer than 5 Democratic House Members or Senators call on Biden to withdraw before July 20th, will Nvidia's market capitalization surpass that of Apple on July 17, 2024?

According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly requested Biden to step aside. Additionally, two of the most vulnerable Democrats have informed local media that they believe Biden has no chance of winning in November.

This market necessitates that fewer than five individuals are involved in the same group communication. If five individuals individually express to reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw, this will not be enough for a YES resolution.

In cases where names are reported but not confirmed with a high degree of certainty, this market will lean towards resolving NO.

If the specified conditions are not met by July 20th, this market will resolve NO.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question resolves YES if, on July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization exceeds that of Apple, as per Companies Market Cap, when verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 3 but not exceeding 4, based on 538's national poll average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the difference in polling between Donald Trump and Joe Biden as indicated in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) for the date of July 15, 2024, which will be checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive result signifies a lead for Trump, whereas a negative result indicates Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

For this inquiry, it does not matter who gets the Republican nomination on the date of the 2024 US election; the decision is solely based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Criteria for determining Q: Resolves as **Yes** if Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential election exceeds 3 and is 4 or less on July 15, 2024, according to the chart accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a lead for Trump.

This means any other candidate is selected, regardless of who it is, as long as it is not Ramaswamy. Then, is it true that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden will be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? question.title: Will Australia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Australia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Australia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Australia competes in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. If Australia fails to qualify, the conclusion will be **No**.

not_P.title: Will Georgia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Georgia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other outcome, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Georgia to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Georgia takes part in a Semi-final and the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) officially declares that they have qualified for the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Any other result will lead to the question being resolved as **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Georgia qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Czechia also qualify?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and if Czechia also participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Grand Final. If Georgia does not qualify, the question resolves as N/A. If Georgia qualifies but Czechia does not, the question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Conditional on Georgia qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Czechia not qualify?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and if Czechia also participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the EBU as not having qualified for the Grand Final. If Georgia does not qualify, the question resolves as N/A. If Georgia qualifies but Czechia does qualify, the question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: If Georgia makes it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Czechia secure a spot as well?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Georgia competes in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and if Czechia also competes in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the EBU as having advanced to the Grand Final. If Georgia fails to qualify, the inquiry resolves as N/A. If Georgia qualifies but Czechia does not, the inquiry resolves as **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Georgia failing to qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will Czechia qualify?
question.body:
This question explores the relationship between the outcomes of Georgia and Czechia in the Eurovision 2024 competition. Suppose the following is true: Georgia does not participate in a Semi-final or is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Given this scenario, will Czechia qualify for the Grand Final?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: Georgia fails to qualify if it does not participate in a Semi-final or is officially announced by the EBU as not having qualified for the Grand Final.
- For the outcome: Czechia qualifies if it participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Grand Final. If Czechia does not qualify, the outcome resolves as No.

not_P.title: Conditional on Georgia qualifying for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will Czechia not qualify?
not_P.body:
This question explores the relationship between the outcomes of Georgia and Czechia in the Eurovision 2024 competition. Suppose the following is true: Georgia participates in a Semi-final or is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Given this scenario, will Czechia not qualify for the Grand Final?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: Georgia qualifies if it participates in a Semi-final or is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Grand Final.
- For the outcome: Czechia does not qualify if it does not participate in a Semi-final or is officially announced by the EBU as not having qualified for the Grand Final. If Czechia qualifies, the outcome resolves as Yes.

para_P.title: If Georgia does not make it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will Czechia secure a spot?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the connection between the results of Georgia and Czechia in the Eurovision 2024 event. Assume the following holds true: Georgia either does not take part in a Semi-final or is publicly declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having failed to qualify for the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Under these circumstances, will Czechia secure a position in the Grand Final?

Criteria for resolution:
- For the condition: Georgia is considered to have failed to qualify if it does not participate in a Semi-final or is officially declared by the EBU as not having qualified for the Grand Final.
- For the outcome: Czechia is deemed to qualify if it competes in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Grand Final. If Czechia does not qualify, the outcome is resolved as No.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

not_P.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain less than 3% among Manifold respondents?
not_P.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by less than 3% when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 < 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump faces Joe Biden instead of a typical Democrat, will he secure at least a 3% increase among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are available, both closing on July 6. One poll prompts Manifold participants to cast their votes with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to vote with a typical Democrat on the same hypothetical ballot.

Public opinion surveys regularly indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump outside the margin of error, whereas all other Democrats surveyed hypothetically are polling ahead or within the margin of error. Are the responses from Manifold participants indicative of the broader public opinion?

This market will be marked YES if Trump's vote percentage in poll 1 surpasses that in poll 2 by 3% or more at the time both polls conclude.

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, use the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). A YES answer is given if the result of this formula for poll 1 minus that of poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. Otherwise, the answer will be NO.

The polls and this inquiry will never resolve as N/A and will stay open until the designated closing time, regardless of circumstances.

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: If Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial, will he gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents against Joe Biden compared to a generic Democrat?
question.body:

Then, will Donald Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot compared to a generic Democrat? The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Ted Cruz not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is not selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Ted Cruz secure the Republican nomination for the 2024 Presidential Election in the United States?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as their nominee for the 2024 Presidential Election in the United States. Any other candidates will result in a **No** answer. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional candidates may be included later.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican party on the day of the 2024 election; the outcome is strictly based on who is appointed by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

Will Joe Biden make a public announcement before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the nomination from the Democratic Party for President?

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will be marked as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear and official statement indicating that he will not seek or accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a Yes resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the upcoming 2024 election.

question.title: GIVEN Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This announcement must be definitive, public, and official, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination for another term. 

Then, is it true that Ted Cruz will be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? The resolution will be Yes if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention delegates, and No otherwise. It does not matter who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the election itself.

para_P.body:
Assuming the following scenario holds: Joe Biden makes a definitive, public, and official statement before July 15, 2024, indicating he will not seek the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This statement must leave no doubt about his refusal to accept the nomination for another term. 

Under these circumstances, can we conclude that Ted Cruz will be nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election? The answer will be Yes if Ted Cruz is nominated by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, and No in all other cases. The identity of the Republican nominee on the election day itself is irrelevant.

question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden does not make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. This means there is room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

Given this, will Ted Cruz be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as Yes if Ted Cruz is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the Republican nominee for the 2024 election. It resolves as No for any other outcome.

Given this, will Ted Cruz not be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? para_P.body:
Assume the following holds true: Joe Biden does not issue a clear, public, official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not run for and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. This implies that there remains a possibility for Biden to accept the nomination.

In light of this, will Ted Cruz be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This will be answered with Yes if Ted Cruz is appointed by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the Republican candidate for the 2024 election. It will be answered with No for any other result.

Suppose the following is true: The linked market does not get at least 377 traders by the end of July 15, 2024. This resolves YES if the market embedded in the link does not have 377 traders before market close on July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time, and NO otherwise.

Then, is it true that on July 21, 2024, the closing value of the BSE SENSEX will be less than or equal to 75,000 or greater than 76,000? The resolution criterion for this is based on the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

Then, is it accurate to say that on July 21, 2024, the final value of the BSE SENSEX will exceed 75,000 and be less than or equal to 76,000? The determination of this is based on the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, as reported by Yahoo Finance.
