para_P.title: If the associated market has less than 377 participants by the end of July 15, will the BSE SENSEX finish between 75,000 and 76,000 on July 21, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: The associated market has fewer than 377 participants before the market closes on July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time, based on the resolution criteria outlined in the market link.

Then, will the closing price of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, be above 75,000 and at or below 76,000, as reported by Yahoo Finance?

question.title: Will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

not_P.title: Will Chris Christie not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Chris Christie is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is Chris Christie going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if Chris Christie is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be considered **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently discussed; additional options may emerge later.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican party on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is strictly based on who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before 7/13?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to NO.

not_P.title: Will Biden not drop out before 7/13?
not_P.body: If Biden does not drop out and is able to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Biden to withdraw from the presidential race prior to July 13?
para_P.body: If Biden withdraws or becomes incapable of pursuing his presidential campaign before midnight on July 13 Central Time, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, it will conclude with a no.

question.title: Given Biden drops out before July 13, will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time. Then, will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criteria for P: Resolves YES if Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run before the specified date and time, otherwise resolves NO.

Resolution criteria for Q: Resolves YES if Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Resolves NO for all other outcomes.

not_P.title: Given Biden drops out before July 13, will Chris Christie not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time. Then, will Chris Christie not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criteria for P: Resolves YES if Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run before the specified date and time, otherwise resolves NO.

Resolution criteria for Q: Resolves YES if Chris Christie is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Resolves NO for all other outcomes.

para_P.title: If Biden withdraws from the race prior to July 13, can we expect Chris Christie to become the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following scenario holds: Biden withdraws or is otherwise incapacitated from continuing his presidential campaign before midnight on July 13 Central Time. Will Chris Christie be chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Criteria for determining P: Resolves to YES if Biden withdraws or is otherwise incapacitated from his campaign before the specified date and time; otherwise, it resolves to NO.

Criteria for determining Q: Resolves to YES if Chris Christie is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election; resolves to NO for all other scenarios.

question.title: Given Biden does not drop out before 7/13, will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden does not drop out and is able to continue his run as president until midnight July 13 Central Time. Then, will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if Biden does not drop out before July 13, 2024. Resolves NO otherwise.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Resolves NO otherwise.

not_P.title: Given Biden drops out before 7/13, will Chris Christie not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden drops out before July 13, 2024. Then, will Chris Christie not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if Biden drops out before July 13, 2024. Resolves NO otherwise.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Chris Christie is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Assuming Biden remains in the race until 7/13, will Chris Christie secure the Republican nomination for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Let’s consider this scenario: Biden continues his presidential campaign and does not withdraw until just before midnight on July 13 Central Time. Under these circumstances, will Chris Christie be chosen as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Criteria for evaluating the condition: Resolves YES if Biden does not withdraw prior to July 13, 2024. Resolves NO if he does.

Criteria for evaluating the outcome: Resolves YES if Chris Christie is nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Resolves NO if he is not.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is not removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention is validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media sources. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The response will be "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that might happen after the specified date. It specifically addresses whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the mentioned criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then later reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or prevented from any ballot, the question will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024.

The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

not_P.title: Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI not increase by more than 0.1% in July?
not_P.body:

The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

para_P.title: Is there a chance that the Core CPI in the US will rise by over 0.1% from June to July?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase greater than 0.1% when compared to the figure from June 2024.

The resolution data will be sourced from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL, using the precise (not rounded) value.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

not_P.title: Will Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and do not cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to not invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Will Biden be determined to be incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be considered YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the responsibilities and duties of his office" and appoint the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's own invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

Context: A GOP lawmaker requests Merrick Garland to activate the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

question.title: Given Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August, will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Given this situation, will the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024? The data for resolution will be from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

para_P.title: If Biden is officially deemed incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August, will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI rise by over 0.1% in July?
para_P.body:
Assume the following scenario: The Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another pertinent authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office," resulting in the Vice President taking on the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry. Instances of Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., are not included. Additionally, Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is not considered.

In light of this context, will the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 show an increase of more than 0.1% relative to June 2024? The resolution will be based on data from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL, using the precise (not rounded) value.

Suppose the following is true: The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

para_P.title: If Biden is not officially deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August, will the US Core CPI show a Month-over-Month rise exceeding 0.1% in July?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: The Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other pertinent authority) do not activate Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office" and thus enable the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this condition. Any scenario where Biden leaves the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is excluded. Additionally, Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is not considered.

Then, is it accurate to say? The seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 rises more than 0.1% in comparison to June 2024.

Criteria for determining the outcome: Resolves to YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase greater than 0.1% relative to June 2024, based on the precise (not rounded) figure from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL.

question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Poland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Poland competes in a Semi-final and is formally recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Poland fails to qualify, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024.  This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect.

It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government

not_P.title: Will Scotland not hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if there is no referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is not held before May 3, 2024.  This referendum may not be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is necessary for the referendum to have no legally binding effect.

It shall be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, or by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must not be deemed to have the consent of the London government.

para_P.title: Will there be an official and authorized vote in Scotland regarding its independence prior to May 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if a vote takes place in Scotland concerning its independence from the United Kingdom, and this vote occurs before May 3, 2024. This vote may be classified as an "advisory" vote; thus, it is not required for the vote to have any legal binding consequences.

A vote will not be regarded as resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” type of vote where the UK government has refused to grant permission for the referendum, nor by a vote organized by civil society groups. A referendum must be recognized as having the approval of the London government.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
not_P.body:

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make a public announcement before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement confirming that he will not pursue or accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any doubt regarding Biden's acceptance of the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a conclusive statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

not_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT not be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
not_P.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is not generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If available in certain EU countries, or available to (for example) minors, this will still resolve negatively, assuming at least <=50% of the population cannot use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves negatively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially different (not entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be accessible to the public in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to the public in the EU by June 30, 2024, and **NO** in any other case.

In this context, "accessible to the public" means that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without a VPN (possibly requiring a subscription). If it is not accessible in specific EU nations (as was the situation in Italy in early 2023), or if it is not available to certain groups (such as minors), the outcome will still be positive, provided that more than 50% of the population can utilize it.

"ChatGPT" in this context refers to the main web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. The outcome remains positive even if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (submitting queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Conditional on ChatGPT being generally available in the EU by June 30, 2024, will Inflection publish a report on external red-teaming of their models for safety by the same date?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024. This means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access ChatGPT without a VPN, possibly requiring payment, and at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, and it resolves positively even if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same.

Given this, will Inflection publish a public report by June 30, 2024, with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models? The question resolves as YES if such a report is published by the specified date, and NO otherwise.

not_P.title: Conditional on ChatGPT being generally available in the EU by June 30, 2024, will Inflection not publish a report on external red-teaming of their models for safety by the same date?

Suppose the following is true: OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, and it resolves positively even if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same.

Given this, will Inflection not publish a public report by June 30, 2024, with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models? The question resolves as YES if no such report is published by the specified date, and NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Assuming that ChatGPT is widely accessible in the EU by June 30, 2024, will Inflection release a report on the external red-teaming of their models for safety by that same date?
para_P.body:
Let us consider the following scenario: OpenAI's ChatGPT is broadly available in the European Union on June 30, 2024. This indicates that the typical situation for individuals in the EU is that they can utilize ChatGPT without needing a VPN, potentially involving a fee, and at least more than half of the population has access to it. The term "ChatGPT" refers to the standard web interface for engaging with GPT models, and it is considered valid even if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same.

In light of this, will Inflection issue a public report by June 30, 2024, detailing the findings from an external red-teaming assessment of the safety of one of their AI models? The answer will be YES if such a report is made available by the given date, and NO if it is not.

question.title: Conditional on ChatGPT not being generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, will Inflection publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On June 30, 2024, OpenAI's ChatGPT is not generally available in the European Union. This means that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN, or less than or equal to 50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, even if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same.

Then, is it true that Inflection will publish a public report with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024? This resolves as YES if such a report is published by that date, and NO otherwise.

not_P.title: Conditional on ChatGPT being generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, will Inflection not publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: On June 30, 2024, OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union. This means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN, or more than 50% of the population can use it. Then, is it true that Inflection will not publish a public report with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024? This resolves as YES if such a report is not published by that date, and NO otherwise.

para_P.title: If ChatGPT is not widely accessible in the EU by June 30, 2024, will Inflection release a report detailing the outcomes of external safety evaluations of their models by that same date?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: On June 30, 2024, OpenAI's ChatGPT is not broadly accessible within the European Union. This implies that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they cannot use it without a VPN, or that 50% or fewer of the population has access to it. The term "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for engaging with GPT models, even if the name or domain has changed, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same.

Therefore, is it accurate to say that Inflection will issue a public report with findings from an external evaluation of the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024? The answer is YES if such a report is made available by that date, and NO if it is not.

question.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

not_P.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet not cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
not_P.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post does not cover the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: In the event that Joe Biden withdraws, will a trustworthy news organization report the story a minimum of 6 hours prior?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered YES if a major and credible news source such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden makes his official announcement of withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc.

Reports from local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be considered adequate.

This market will be deemed N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be 2 or less, or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden be more than 2 but at most 3 according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as depicted in the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies Biden's lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would translate to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title:
Will the  CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS)	
 be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

not_P.title: Will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be lower Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?

para_P.title: Is the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) expected to be greater on July 20, 2024 compared to July 20, 2023?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be determined by the data provided by the St. Louis Fed at this link: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The value reported for July 20, 2024 must exceed the value reported for July 20, 2023.

question.title: If the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index is higher YoY on July 20, 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden be > 2 and <= 3 on July 15, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) is higher on July 20, 2024, than it was on July 20, 2023, according to the St. Louis Fed report. Then, is it true that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The VXVCLS value reported on July 20, 2024, must be greater than the value reported on July 20, 2023.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Trump's lead over Biden must be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points according to 538's national polling average as reported on July 15, 2024, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Trump's lead over Biden must be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 points according to 538's national polling average as reported on July 15, 2024, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Criteria for determining the outcome: Trump's lead over Biden must be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points according to 538's national polling average as of July 15, 2024, which is accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a lead for Trump.

question.title: Will Georgia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other outcome, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Georgia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Georgia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other outcome, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Georgia going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Georgia takes part in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any different result, the inquiry will be regarded as **No**.

question.title: Will Estonia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Estonia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Estonia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Estonia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Estonia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Estonia qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Estonia going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if Estonia takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Estonia fails to qualify, the inquiry will be marked as **No**.

question.title: Given Estonia qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Georgia also qualify?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Estonia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Georgia also qualify for the Grand Final? Georgia must participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final for the answer to be Yes.

not_P.title: Given Estonia qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Georgia not qualify?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: Estonia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Georgia also not qualify for the Grand Final? Georgia must participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final for the answer to be Yes.

para_P.title: If Estonia makes it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Georgia also make it?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds true: Estonia takes part in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. In that case, will Georgia also advance to the Grand Final? For the answer to be Yes, Georgia needs to compete in a Semi-final and be confirmed by the EBU as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.

question.title: Given Estonia fails to qualify for the Grand Final, will Georgia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Estonia does not qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. This means that Estonia either did not participate in a Semi-final or participated and was not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified.

Now, given this scenario, will Georgia qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final? This question will resolve as **Yes** if Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other outcome, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Given Estonia fails to qualify for the Grand Final, will Georgia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Estonia does not qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. This means that Estonia either did not participate in a Semi-final or participated and was not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified.

Now, given this scenario, will Georgia not qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final? This question will resolve as **Yes** if Georgia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other outcome, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: If Estonia does not make it to the Grand Final, can we expect Georgia to reach the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Estonia does not make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. This implies that Estonia either did not compete in a Semi-final or competed but was not recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified.

In light of this situation, can we expect Georgia to reach the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024? This question will be answered with **Yes** if Georgia competes in a Semi-final and is recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. For any other outcome, the answer will be **No**.

para_P.title: If M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) earns a CinemaScore of B- or less, will the opening weekend box office for "Deadpool & Wolverine" exceed the total of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine"?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) earns a CinemaScore of B- or less. This market will resolve YES if "Trap" (2024) gets a B- CinemaScore or lower, and it will resolve NO if it receives a B or higher. If a CinemaScore is not available for any reason, this will resolve N/A.

Context:

"Trap" is the upcoming film directed by the renowned M. Night Shyamalan (which has an impressive trailer).

Here are the CinemaScores for several of his recent works:

"Split" - B+

"Glass" - B

"Old" - C+

"Knock at the Cabin" - C

You can look up more examples on the CinemaScore website.

So, is it accurate to say that the domestic box office opening for "Deadpool & Wolverine" will surpass the combined earnings of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine"? This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for **Deadpool & Wolverine**, as reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1), exceeds $185,548,391, which is the total of the box office openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is removed or blocked from a ballot, the question resolves positively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or barring is validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media sources. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will conclude with a "No" if these criteria are not fulfilled as of July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may happen *after* the specified date. It solely focuses on whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and then later reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or barred from any ballot, the question will resolve in the negative.

question.title: Will Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Francis Suarez not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Francis Suarez is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Francis Suarez going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:

Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to those candidates currently mentioned; additional options may emerge in the future.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who obtains the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is solely based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

not_P.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the underdog on Friday?
not_P.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will conclude with a "No" if Donald Trump is deemed to have a higher likelihood of winning than Joe Biden according to the same forecast. In the event that both candidates are viewed as having equal chances, the outcome will be 50-50.

The source for this resolution will be the FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically referencing the values shown by the blue and red trend lines on the date of resolution for this market. Any changes in the methodology used by FiveThirtyEight to compute its figures will not impact the outcome of this market.

This market will be resolved based on the data for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is released. The resolution may be delayed until the July 20 data is accessible. If data for July 19 is not available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the resolution will rely on the closest prior figures to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution pertains to the winning probabilities for each candidate expressed as a number out of 100, rounded to one decimal place (e.g., "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be taken into account.

question.title: Will Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Malta not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Malta going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Malta takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they fail to qualify, the resolution will be **No**.

question.title: Will Serbia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Serbia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For all other countries, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Serbia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Serbia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For all other countries, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Serbia going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Serbia competes in a Semi-final and is formally declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. In all other cases concerning different nations, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Given Serbia qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Malta also qualify?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Serbia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Malta also qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

Resolution criteria: For Malta, this resolves as **Yes** if Malta participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Malta does not qualify, it resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Given Serbia qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Malta not qualify?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Serbia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Malta not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

Resolution criteria: For Malta, this resolves as **Yes** if Malta does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Malta qualifies, it resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: If Serbia makes it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Malta also make it?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is correct: Serbia competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. In that case, will Malta also secure a place in the Grand Final for Eurovision 2024?

Resolution criteria: For Malta, this is considered **Yes** if Malta competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the EBU as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Malta fails to qualify, it will be **No**.

question.title: Given that Serbia fails to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Malta qualify?
question.body:
This question addresses two separate outcomes for the Eurovision 2024 contest.

Condition: Serbia must participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having failed to qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.

Outcome: Malta must participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final for this to resolve as **Yes**. If Malta does not qualify, it resolves as **No**.

If the condition regarding Serbia is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

not_P.title: Given that Serbia qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Malta not qualify?
not_P.body:
This question addresses two separate outcomes for the Eurovision 2024 contest.

Condition: Serbia must participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.

Outcome: Malta must participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having not qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final for this to resolve as **Yes**. If Malta qualifies, it resolves as **No**.

If the condition regarding Serbia is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If Serbia does not make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Malta make it?
para_P.body:
This inquiry concerns two distinct results for the Eurovision 2024 event.

Prerequisite: Serbia must take part in a Semi-final and be formally declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having not qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.

Result: Malta must also participate in a Semi-final and be officially recognized by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final for this to conclude as **Yes**. Should Malta fail to qualify, it will conclude as **No**.

If the prerequisite regarding Serbia is not satisfied, the inquiry concludes as N/A.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Democrats not have a brokered convention in 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party does not require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will the Democratic Party experience a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if the Democrats need multiple rounds of voting during their roll call ballot to officially select their candidate for the 2024 presidential election in the United States. Conversely, if a single ballot suffices, then the outcome will be **No**.

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Democratic Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

question.title: Given 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before midnight July 20 Central Time, 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out, as shown on the New York Times interactive election page. Then, will the Democratic Party require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election? 

Resolution criteria:
- Condition: Resolves YES if at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, the New York Times interactive election page shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out. Otherwise, resolves NO.
- Outcome: Resolves YES if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Resolves NO if only one ballot is required.

not_P.title: Given 10 or more Democratic Senators do not call for Biden to drop out before July 20, will Democrats not have a brokered convention in 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before midnight July 20 Central Time, 10 or more Democratic Senators do not call for Biden to drop out, as shown on the New York Times interactive election page. Then, will the Democratic Party not require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election? 

Resolution criteria:
- Condition: Resolves YES if at no point before midnight July 20 Central Time, the New York Times interactive election page shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out. Otherwise, resolves NO.
- Outcome: Resolves YES if the Democratic Party does not require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Resolves NO if only one ballot is required.

para_P.title: If 10 or more Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20, will there be a brokered convention for the Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following scenario holds true: Before the clock strikes midnight on July 20 Central Time, at least 10 Democratic Senators publicly advocate for Biden to step aside, as indicated on the New York Times interactive election page. Will the Democratic Party need to conduct multiple rounds of voting in its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election? 

Resolution criteria:
- Condition: Resolves to YES if, at any time prior to midnight July 20 Central Time, the New York Times interactive election page displays that 10 or more Democratic Senators are calling for Biden to withdraw. If not, it resolves to NO.
- Outcome: Resolves to YES if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Resolves to NO if only a single ballot is necessary.

question.title: Conditional on fewer than 10 Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out before July 20, will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Fewer than 10 Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024. This is determined by the New York Times tracking page, which resolves as 'Yes' if at no point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out.

Then, will the Democratic Party require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election? This question resolves as 'Yes' if more than one round of voting is needed, indicating a brokered convention. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as 'No'.

not_P.title: Conditional on fewer than 10 Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out before July 20, will Democrats not have a brokered convention in 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Fewer than 10 Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024. This is determined by the New York Times tracking page, which resolves as 'Yes' if at no point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out.

Then, will the Democratic Party not require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election? This question resolves as 'Yes' if only one ballot is required, indicating that a brokered convention is not needed. If more than one round of voting is needed, then this question resolves as 'No'.

para_P.title: Given that fewer than 10 Democratic Senators demand Biden's resignation before July 20, will the Democrats hold a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body:
Assume the following condition holds: Less than 10 Democratic Senators request Biden to step down prior to July 20, 2024. This is verified by the New York Times tracking page, which concludes with 'Yes' if, at no time before midnight July 20 Central Time, there are 10 or more Democratic Senators advocating for Biden's departure.

Under these circumstances, will the Democratic Party need to conduct more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election? This question will be answered with 'Yes' if multiple rounds of voting are necessary, signifying a brokered convention. Conversely, if only a single ballot is needed, the answer will be 'No'.

question.title: Will OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, both of the following are true:

- OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". 
- Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

not_P.title: Will OpenAI not publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, at least one of the following is true:

- OpenAI does not publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must not indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it must be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". 
- Metaculus does not verify that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may not reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must not be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Will OpenAI affirm its commitment to the principle of "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered resolved as **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, the following two conditions are met:

- OpenAI publicly affirms its commitment to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle through a statement from the organization or a representative, such as Sam Altman. This statement can be either formal (like a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or a comment made during an interview). The communication from OpenAI must reflect a new commitment level to the principle in question, compared to the period when the righttowarn.ai statement was released; it cannot simply restate that, for instance, "we already promote a culture of open criticism". 
- Metaculus confirms that the organization has embraced the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may contact select signatories or endorsers to evaluate their satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as strong as "this was a good initial step" for this question to be resolved as **Yes**.

question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before July 1, 2024, OpenAI does not publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle. This means at least one of the following must be true:

- OpenAI has not issued a new public statement of commitment to this principle, either formally or informally, that indicates a new level of commitment compared to when the righttowarn.ai statement was published.
- Metaculus has not verified that OpenAI's commitment is satisfactory to at least one member of righttowarn.ai, with statements being at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step".

Given this condition, will the Pandemic Agreement be approved during the May 2024 World Health Assembly? This resolves as **Yes** if the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote during the May 2024 WHA, according to credible sources. If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

- Metaculus has not confirmed that OpenAI's commitment meets the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai, with statements being no less rigorous than "this was a good first step."

Under this stipulation, will the Pandemic Agreement be sanctioned during the May 2024 World Health Assembly? This will be resolved as **Yes** if the Pandemic Agreement is endorsed in a vote at the May 2024 WHA, according to reliable sources. If the condition is unmet, the resolution is N/A.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

Resolution criteria: 
- The condition is met if the Philadelphia 76ers win the 2024 NBA Finals.
- The outcome resolves Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals in Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball. It resolves No if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold. If the condition is not met, the question resolves N/A.

Suppose the following is true: The Philadelphia 76ers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to the NBA. Then, will Team USA not win both gold medals in Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics?

- The condition is met if the Philadelphia 76ers win the 2024 NBA Finals.
- The outcome resolves Yes if Team USA does not win both gold medals in Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball. It resolves No if both the men's and women's teams place gold. If the condition is not met, the question resolves N/A.

para_P.body:
Assuming the following statement holds true: The Philadelphia 76ers are declared the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals as per the NBA's announcement. In that case, will the United States team achieve gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball during the Paris Olympic Games? 

Resolution criteria: 
- The condition is satisfied if the Philadelphia 76ers win the 2024 NBA Finals.
- The outcome is considered Yes if Team USA clinches both gold medals in Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball. It will be No if either the men's or women's team finishes in a position other than first place. If the condition is not satisfied, the question will be marked N/A.

question.title: Given the Philadelphia 76ers do not win the 2024 NBA Finals, will the United States win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics?
question.body:
Resolution criteria for the condition: The question resolves **Yes** if the Philadelphia 76ers are not crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves **No** if the Philadelphia 76ers win the 2024 NBA Finals.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals in Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics. Resolves No if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.

If the condition is not met (i.e., if the Philadelphia 76ers win the 2024 NBA Finals), the question resolves as N/A.
