Resolution criteria for the condition: The question resolves **Yes** if the Philadelphia 76ers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves **No** if the Philadelphia 76ers do not win the 2024 NBA Finals.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves Yes if Team USA does not win both gold medals in Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics. Resolves No if both the men's and women's teams win gold.

para_P.title: If the Philadelphia 76ers fail to secure victory in the 2024 NBA Finals, will the United States achieve gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympic Games?
para_P.body:
The criteria for determining the condition: The question is answered **Yes** if the Philadelphia 76ers do not become the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, based on [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It is answered **No** if the Philadelphia 76ers are victorious in the 2024 NBA Finals.

The criteria for the outcome: The answer is Yes if Team USA claims both gold medals in Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympic Games. The answer is No if either the men's or women's team fails to win gold.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

question.title: Will at least 24 world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater.

not_P.title: Will fewer than 24 world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is less than 24.

para_P.title: Is it possible for 24 or more world records to be set at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if the total number of world records established during the Paris Olympics reaches 24 or exceeds that figure.

question.title: Will France place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if France place in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medal

not_P.title: Will France not place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve positively if France does not place in the top 5 (ties resolve negatively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medal.

para_P.title: Will France finish among the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if France finishes in the top 5 (ties are counted as affirmative) at the Olympic Games occurring in 2024. It will be deemed unclear if the Olympics do not occur in 2024.

The ranking of the medal table is determined by the total count of medals earned by each competing nation, ordered by:

1. Total Gold Medals
2. (In case of a tie for 1st) Total Silver Medals
3. (In case of a tie for 2nd) Total Bronze Medals.

In light of this scenario, the question then posits: Will there be at least 24 world records set during the 2024 Paris Olympics? This will be deemed **Yes** if the number of world records established at the Paris Olympics reaches 24 or more.

question.title: Will Norway qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Norway participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Norway does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Norway not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Norway does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Norway qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Norway set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Norway competes in a Semi-final and is formally declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Norway fails to qualify, the inquiry will conclude with a **No**.

para_P.title: Is Switzerland going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

question.title: If Switzerland qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Norway also qualify?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Switzerland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Given this, will Norway also qualify for the Grand Final? This question will resolve as **Yes** if Norway participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Norway does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: If Switzerland qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Norway not qualify?

This question will resolve as **Yes** if Norway does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Norway qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Should Norway make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024 if Switzerland does?
para_P.body: Assuming the following scenario: Switzerland takes part in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. In light of this, is it also the case that Norway will progress to the Grand Final? This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Norway competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the EBU as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Norway fails to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Given Switzerland fails to qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will Norway qualify?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Switzerland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Norway qualify for the Grand Final?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Norway participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Norway does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Given Switzerland fails to qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will Norway not qualify?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Switzerland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Norway not qualify for the Grand Final?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Norway participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Norway qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: If Switzerland does not make it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, can Norway secure a spot?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Switzerland takes part in a Semi-final and the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) officially states that it has not qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. In that case, can Norway secure a place in the Grand Final?

The outcome will be determined as **Yes** if Norway competes in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Norway fails to qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

not_P.title: Will Russia not have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) does not show the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:

- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location

The question will resolve as **No** if the location is assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:

- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

para_P.title: By June 1, 2024, will Chasiv Yar be under Russian control?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, when checked by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) indicates the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as belonging to any of the following classifications:



- Evaluated Russian Progress in Ukraine

- Evaluated Russian Gains within the Last 24 Hours

- Evaluated Russian Authority

- Asserted Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other classifications established by ISW that signify Russian authority over the site



The inquiry will be resolved as **No** if the site is not categorized under any of the designations indicating Russian authority, which includes but is not limited to:



- Documented Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Last 24 Hours

- Asserted Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Documented Ukrainian Partisan Activities

- Any other classifications established by ISW that signify Ukrainian authority over the site or the absence of Russian authority over the site.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The absence of removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is not removed or blocked from a ballot and then removed, such that as of July 15th he is removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be barred or excluded from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially barred or excluded from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The barring or exclusion must be verified through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be deemed "No" if these criteria are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may happen *after* the specified date. It strictly addresses whether Donald Trump has been barred from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is barred or excluded from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not barred or excluded from any ballot, the inquiry resolves negatively.

question.title: If Donald Trump is removed from the primary election ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will Russia control Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. This is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports, excluding speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements. If Trump is removed or blocked and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked, this condition is not met.

Then, will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024? This resolves as YES if the ISW map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under Russian control or claimed Russian territory. It resolves as NO if the location is not shown as under Russian control, including categories indicating Ukrainian control or a lack of Russian control.

If Trump is removed or blocked and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked, this condition is not met.

Then, will Russia not have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024? This resolves as YES if the ISW map does not show the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under Russian control or claimed Russian territory. It resolves as NO if the location is shown as under Russian control, including categories indicating Ukrainian control or a lack of Russian control.

If Trump is initially disqualified or barred and then reinstated, meaning that as of July 15th he is no longer disqualified or barred, this condition is not satisfied.

In that case, will Russia possess control over Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024? If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves affirmatively.

The question will resolve as **Yes** if the location is in any of these categories indicating Russian control, and **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to: Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives, Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare, or any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

para_P.title: Assuming Donald Trump remains on all primary election ballots as per Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will Russia have authority over Chasiv Yar by June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Let us consider this scenario: By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially excluded or barred from the primary election ballots of any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. There are no formal announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports that confirm such exclusion or barring. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements do not count for resolution. This inquiry does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or any subsequent changes that may happen after the specified date. It strictly focuses on whether Donald Trump has not been removed or barred from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated conditions as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is initially removed or barred from a ballot and then restored, leading to the situation where as of July 15th he is not removed or barred from any ballot, the question will be answered affirmatively.

The answer will be **Yes** if the location is categorized under any of these classifications indicating Russian control, and **No** if the location is not classified as such, which includes but is not limited to: Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives, Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare, or any other classifications created by ISW that signify Ukrainian control over the area or a lack of Russian control.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump surpasses Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 3, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as illustrated on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, translating to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Conditional on a member of the Trump family being the Republican nominee, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: A member of the Trump family, specifically one of the following individuals: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump, is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024. Then, will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves **Yes** if one of the specified members of the Trump family is the Republican nominee.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve based on Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead. The question resolves **Yes** if the lead is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3, and **No** otherwise.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.body:
There are two polls conducted by Manifold that are set to close on July 6. One poll asks Manifold respondents to cast their vote alongside Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other presents a generic Democrat for the same ballot.

Public opinion surveys regularly indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat considered in these hypothetical scenarios either leads or remains within the margin of error. Are the Manifold respondents reflective of the broader public opinion?

This market will be resolved as YES if Donald Trump's vote percentage in the first poll exceeds that in the second poll by 3% or more when both polls conclude.

The calculation for determining Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer will be YES if the difference between the first poll's formula and the second poll's formula is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer will be NO.

The polls and this question will not resolve as N/A and will remain open until the specified closing time regardless of circumstances.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/24034/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question resolves as Yes if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports:

The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).

The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Ted Cruz not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies Biden's lead. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would translate to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

not_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT not be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
not_P.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is not generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If available in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or available to (for example) minors, this will still resolve negatively, assuming at least >50% of the population cannot use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves negatively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially different (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.body:

In this context, "widely accessible" implies that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without the need for a VPN (though it may require a payment). If it is not available in some EU nations (as was seen in Italy in early 2023), or if it is not accessible to specific groups (such as minors), it will still be considered a positive outcome if more than 50% of the population can utilize it.

"ChatGPT" in this context denotes the general web interface (not the API) used for engaging with GPT models. It will still be considered a positive outcome even if the name or website changes, provided that OpenAI's service remains largely unchanged (allowing users to input queries into systems powered by Large Language Models).

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

Then, is it true that Google DeepMind will publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024? For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as YES if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

not_P.title: Conditional on OpenAI's ChatGPT being generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, will Google DeepMind not publish a report with external red-teaming results by then?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024. "Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly not requiring payment for it.) If available in certain EU countries (as was not the case in Italy in early 2023), or available to (for example) minors, this will resolve negatively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves negatively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

Then, is it true that Google DeepMind will not publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024? For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as YES if, by June 30, 2024, they do not publish a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Assuming that OpenAI's ChatGPT is not widely accessible in the EU by June 30, 2024, will Google DeepMind release a report containing findings from external red-teaming by that date?
para_P.body:
Let us consider the following scenario: OpenAI's ChatGPT is not broadly accessible in the European Union on June 30, 2024. "Not broadly accessible" means that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they cannot use it without a VPN (which may involve a fee). If it is unavailable in specific EU nations (as was seen in Italy in early 2023), or if it is not accessible to (for instance) minors, this will be considered a positive resolution, provided that more than 50% of the populace cannot access it. Here, "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (inputting queries into systems driven by Large Language Models).

Therefore, is it correct that Google DeepMind will make public a report with the findings from external red-teaming of their models regarding safety by June 30, 2024? For Google DeepMind, this question is answered with YES if they release a public report with the results from an external entity red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceed 3 based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as depicted on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump 2.4 points in front of Biden, which would be considered a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?

If Biden does not appear in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If a qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Will there be a 45+ minute in-person interview or on-camera discussion with Joe Biden before the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
The latest qualifying interview took place in April when Biden was featured on The Howard Stern Show, where he responded to inquiries for approximately 70 minutes. 

For this market to resolve as YES, Biden must participate in another in-person interview lasting at least 45 minutes. If no qualifying interview is made public before the market closes at the end of July, it will resolve as NO. 

This market does not take into account press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It may include guest appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or segments edited into programs like 60 Minutes, provided there is a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in person. A 50-minute video that only includes 20 minutes of Biden's interview footage would not qualify. 

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous segments on 60 Minutes each contained less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed. 

A compilation of Biden's interviews and their transcripts can be found here.

question.title: If Joe Biden has an in-person interview on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?

This excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but includes appearances on podcasts, late night shows, or interviews edited into shows like 60 minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person.

Resolution criteria for this condition: The market resolves YES if such an interview occurs before the end of July 2024, and NO if no qualifying interview is released by then.

Given this condition, the question is whether Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average as reported on the chart for that date. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead. The value will be checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

para_P.body:
Imagine that Joe Biden takes part in a direct, on-camera discussion or interview for no less than 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This does not include events like press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, or town halls, but does cover appearances on podcasts, late-night television shows, or segments edited into programs like 60 Minutes, as long as there is a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden in an in-person interview.

For this condition, the market will determine a YES if such an interview takes place before the end of July 2024, and a NO if no suitable interview is published by that time.

Taking this condition into account, the inquiry is whether Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden will exceed 2 and be 3 or fewer points on July 15, 2024, according to the national polling average from 538 displayed on the chart for that date. A positive figure reflects a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates a Biden lead. The value will be verified by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not die before Saturday?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if there is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Joe Biden to pass away before Saturday?
para_P.body:
This will be marked as YES if there is an official declaration of Joe Biden's passing prior to the market's closing on Friday, July 26th. 

If not, it will be marked as NO.

question.title: Will the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?
question.body: Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

not_P.title: Will the head of the Secret Service not resign within the next 90 days?
not_P.body: Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, not resign, not be fired, and for no other reason continue to be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

para_P.title: Is it possible that the head of the Secret Service will step down in the coming 90 days?
para_P.body: Is there a chance that Kimberly Cheatle, who serves as the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, will resign, be dismissed, or otherwise cease to hold the position of director of the Secret Service prior to October 12, 2024?

question.title: Given the head of the Secret Service resigns within the next 90 days, will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body: Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024? Suppose this happens. Then, will there be an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th? Resolves YES if such an announcement is made, otherwise, resolves NO.

not_P.title: Given the head of the Secret Service does not resign within the next 90 days, will Joe Biden not die before Saturday?
not_P.body: Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, not resign, not be fired, or for any other reason continue to be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024? Suppose this happens. Then, will there be no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th? Resolves YES if such an announcement is not made, otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: If the head of the Secret Service steps down in the next 90 days, will Joe Biden pass away before Saturday?
para_P.body: Is it possible that Kimberly Cheatle, who is the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, will either resign, be dismissed, or otherwise cease to be the director of the Secret Service prior to October 12, 2024? Assuming this occurs, will there be an official declaration of Joe Biden's death before the market closes on Friday, July 26th? This will resolve to YES if such a declaration is made, and NO if it is not.

question.title: Conditional on the head of the Secret Service not resigning within the next 90 days, will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, remain in her position and not resign, not be fired, and for no other reason continue to be the director of the Secret Service until October 12, 2024? 

Suppose this is true. Then, will there be an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th? 

The question resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before the specified time. Otherwise, it resolves NO. If the condition regarding the Secret Service head is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

not_P.title: Conditional on the head of the Secret Service resigning within the next 90 days, will Joe Biden not die before Saturday?
not_P.body:
Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason not continue to be the director of the Secret Service until October 12, 2024? 

Suppose this is true. Then, will there be no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th? 

The question resolves YES if there is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before the specified time. Otherwise, it resolves NO. If the condition regarding the Secret Service head is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: Assuming the head of the Secret Service remains in office and does not resign within the next 90 days, will Joe Biden pass away before Saturday?
para_P.body:
Is it the case that Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, will continue to serve in her role without resigning, being dismissed, or any other reason for her not to be the director of the Secret Service until October 12, 2024? 

If this holds true, then will there be an official declaration of Joe Biden's death prior to the market closing on Friday, July 26th? 

The answer is YES if there is an official statement regarding Joe Biden's death before the mentioned deadline. Otherwise, the answer is NO. If the condition concerning the head of the Secret Service is not fulfilled, the answer is considered N/A.

question.title: Before July 1, 2024, will the International Criminal Court issue arrest warrants for any of the listed Israeli leaders?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)

not_P.title: Before July 1, 2024, will the International Criminal Court not issue arrest warrants for any of the listed Israeli leaders?

para_P.title: Will any of the specified Israeli leaders have arrest warrants issued by the International Criminal Court prior to July 1, 2024?

* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

question.title: Will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

not_P.title: Will no terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
not_P.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if no terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: Is a terrorist incident expected to take place in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if a terrorist incident in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) results in injuries and/or fatalities of at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), from the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) to the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). Conversely, this inquiry will be considered negative if such an event does not occur.

An occurrence will be classified as a 'terrorist incident' if it is identified as such by any French State agency, or by the President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers of France.

question.title: Conditional on a terrorist act occurring in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will the ICC issue arrest warrants for listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: A terrorist attack occurs in Metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, injuring or killing at least one person other than the terrorist(s) between July 26, 2024, and August 11, 2024. The event is described as a 'terrorist attack' by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Then, is it true that before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a warrant of arrest for any of the following Israeli cabinet members: Benjamin Netanyahu, Yoav Gallant, or Herzi Halevi? If the ICC issues such a warrant before July 1, 2024, the question resolves as Yes. Otherwise, it resolves as No.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

not_P.title: Conditional on a terrorist act occurring in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will the ICC not issue arrest warrants for listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: A terrorist attack occurs in Metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, injuring or killing at least one person other than the terrorist(s) between July 26, 2024, and August 11, 2024. The event is described as a 'terrorist attack' by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Then, is it true that before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) does not issue a warrant of arrest for any of the following Israeli cabinet members: Benjamin Netanyahu, Yoav Gallant, or Herzi Halevi? If the ICC does not issue such a warrant before July 1, 2024, the question resolves as Yes. Otherwise, it resolves as No.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: Given the occurrence of a terrorist incident in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will the ICC release arrest warrants for specified Israeli officials prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: A terrorist incident takes place in Metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, resulting in injuries or fatalities to at least one individual other than the terrorist(s) between July 26, 2024, and August 11, 2024. The incident is classified as a 'terrorist incident' by any French state agency, or by the President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers of France.

Under these circumstances, is it accurate to say that before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues an arrest warrant for any of the following Israeli government officials: Benjamin Netanyahu, Yoav Gallant, or Herzi Halevi? If the ICC does issue such a warrant before July 1, 2024, the answer is Yes. If not, the answer is No.

If the initial condition is not fulfilled, the answer is N/A.

question.title: Conditional on no terrorist act occurring in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will the ICC issue arrest warrants for listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: No terrorist attack in metropolitan France injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event is considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Then, will the International Criminal Court (ICC) issue a warrant of arrest for any of the following Israeli cabinet members before July 1, 2024?

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

Resolution criteria: Resolves YES if the ICC issues a warrant of arrest for any of the listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024. Resolves NO otherwise.

not_P.title: Conditional on a terrorist act occurring in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will the ICC not issue arrest warrants for listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: A terrorist attack in metropolitan France injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event is considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Then, will the International Criminal Court (ICC) not issue a warrant of arrest for any of the following Israeli cabinet members before July 1, 2024?

Resolution criteria: Resolves YES if the ICC does not issue a warrant of arrest for any of the listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: If no acts of terrorism take place in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will the ICC release arrest warrants for specified Israeli officials prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: There are no terrorist incidents in metropolitan France that result in injury or death to anyone other than the perpetrators, from the date of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) to the date of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An incident is categorized as a 'terrorist act' if it is labeled as such by any French State agency, or by the President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers of France.

In that case, will the International Criminal Court (ICC) issue arrest warrants for any of the following members of the Israeli cabinet before July 1, 2024?

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

The outcome will be YES if the ICC issues a warrant for any of the specified Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024. It will be NO otherwise.

question.title: Will Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Malta not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they do qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Malta set to advance to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Malta takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Should they fail to qualify, the inquiry will be regarded as **No**.

question.title: Will Slovenia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

para_P.title: Is Slovenia going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if Slovenia takes part in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Slovenia fails to qualify, the outcome will be recorded as **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Slovenia qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Malta also qualify?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Slovenia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Malta also qualify for the Grand Final? 

Resolution criteria for Malta: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Conditional on Slovenia qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Malta not qualify?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Slovenia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Malta not qualify for the Grand Final? 

Resolution criteria for Malta: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having not qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they do qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: If Slovenia secures a spot in the Grand Final at Eurovision 2024, can we expect Malta to do the same?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following scenario is accurate: Slovenia competes in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having made it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. In that case, will Malta also make it to the Grand Final? 

Criteria for Malta's qualification: This query will yield a resolution of **Yes** if Malta competes in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Malta fails to qualify, the resolution will be **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Slovenia failing to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Malta qualify?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Slovenia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Malta participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final? If Malta qualifies, the question resolves as **Yes**. If Malta does not qualify, the question resolves as **No**. If Slovenia does not fail to qualify, the condition is not met.

not_P.title: Conditional on Slovenia qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Malta not qualify?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: Slovenia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Malta participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final? If Malta qualifies, the question resolves as **Yes**. If Malta does not qualify, the question resolves as **No**. If Slovenia does not qualify, the condition is not met.

para_P.title: If Slovenia does not make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, can Malta secure a spot?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds true: Slovenia takes part in a Semi-final and is declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having made it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. In this case, will Malta also compete in a Semi-final and be confirmed by the EBU as having made it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final? A qualification for Malta would lead to a **Yes** answer, while a failure to qualify would result in a **No** answer. If Slovenia does qualify, then the premise is not satisfied.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 3 but not exceeding 4 based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In the context of this question, a positive number indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative number signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure indicates Trump is 2.4 points in front of Biden, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

question.title: Will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

not_P.title: Will Chris Christie not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Chris Christie is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Any other candidates will be answered with **No**. This query is not limited to the candidates presently mentioned; additional options may emerge in the future.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who obtains the Republican nomination on the date of the 2024 US election; the decision is solely based on who is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

In this context, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in the national polling average from 538 for the 2024 presidential election be more than 3 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024? This means that any other candidate is selected, and it is not relevant who receives the nomination on the election day, only who is selected by the convention delegates.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024? para_P.body:

question.title: Will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

not_P.title: Will Greens–EFA not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **No**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will the Greens–EFA group secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 elections for the European Parliament?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political faction secures the highest number of seats after the European Parliament elections in 2024, and with **No** for any other results. In cases where two factions have an equal number of seats, both sub-questions will be answered with **Yes**.

The resolution of this question will rely on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or trustworthy media sources.

question.title: Will GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

not_P.title: Will GUE/NGL not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if GUE/NGL does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will GUE/NGL secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if GUE/NGL secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for any other political factions. In the event that two factions are tied for seats, both will be considered as **Yes**.

This question will be resolved based on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media sources.

question.title: Conditional on GUE/NGL holding the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will Greens–EFA also hold the most seats?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group also holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. If both GUE/NGL and Greens–EFA are tied for the most seats, this question resolves as **Yes**. This question resolves on the basis of official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

not_P.title: Conditional on GUE/NGL holding the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will Greens–EFA not hold the most seats?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. If both GUE/NGL and Greens–EFA are tied for the most seats, this question resolves as **No**. This question resolves on the basis of official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

para_P.title: If GUE/NGL secures the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will the Greens–EFA also secure the highest number of seats?
para_P.body: Assuming that GUE/NGL indeed has the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, this inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group also has the highest number of seats after these elections. In the event that GUE/NGL and Greens–EFA are tied for the highest number of seats, this inquiry will also be answered with **Yes**. The resolution of this inquiry will depend on official announcements from the European Parliament or reliable news sources.

question.title: Given GUE/NGL does not hold the most seats, will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: GUE/NGL does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This means that GUE/NGL either has fewer seats than the group with the most seats or is not tied for the most seats. Now, under this condition, will the Greens–EFA political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections?

Resolution criteria:
1. For the condition (GUE/NGL not holding the most seats): This resolves as **Yes** if GUE/NGL does not hold the most seats. If GUE/NGL holds the most seats or is tied for the most, it resolves as **No**.
2. For the outcome (Greens–EFA holding the most seats): This resolves as **Yes** if Greens–EFA holds the most seats and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for the most seats, both are considered to hold the most seats.

Both criteria are based on [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

not_P.title: Given GUE/NGL holds the most seats, will Greens–EFA not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This means that GUE/NGL either has more seats than the group with the most seats or is tied for the most seats. Now, under this condition, will the Greens–EFA political group not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections?

Resolution criteria:
1. For the condition (GUE/NGL holding the most seats): This resolves as **Yes** if GUE/NGL holds the most seats. If GUE/NGL does not hold the most seats or is tied for the most, it resolves as **No**.
2. For the outcome (Greens–EFA not holding the most seats): This resolves as **Yes** if Greens–EFA does not hold the most seats and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for the most seats, both are considered to hold the most seats.

Both criteria are based on [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: If GUE/NGL does not have the highest number of seats, will the Greens–EFA secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: GUE/NGL does not possess the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This indicates that GUE/NGL either has a lesser number of seats than the group with the highest count or is not in a tie for the highest count. Now, under this premise, will the Greens–EFA political faction have the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections?

Resolution criteria:
1. For the condition (GUE/NGL not having the highest number of seats): This resolves as **Yes** if GUE/NGL does not have the highest number of seats. If GUE/NGL has the highest number of seats or is tied for the highest, it resolves as **No**.
2. For the outcome (Greens–EFA having the highest number of seats): This resolves as **Yes** if Greens–EFA has the highest number of seats and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two factions are tied for the highest number of seats, both are considered to have the highest number of seats.

Both criteria are based on [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.
