question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will 538 designate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is projected to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will result in a “No” if Donald Trump is shown to have a higher likelihood of winning compared to Joe Biden, according to the same forecast for that date. In the event that both candidates are assessed to have equal chances, the market will resolve at 50-50.

The source for resolution will be FiveThirtyEight's forecast for the 2024 presidential election, found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically referencing the data indicated by the blue and red trend lines on the resolution date. Any alterations in how FiveThirtyEight calculates its data will not affect the outcome of this market.

This market will conclude based on the data points for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is released. It is possible that the market may not resolve until the July 20 data is available. If data for July 19 is not accessible by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve based on the closest previous data to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution pertains to the probability of each candidate winning expressed as a number out of 100, rounded to one decimal place (e.g., "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations won by each candidate out of 1,000 will not be taken into account.

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not testify at the hush money trial?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has not testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump provide testimony during the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, either in person or via remote means, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels.

question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if credible sources report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

Resolution criteria for the condition: Donald Trump must testify at the trial, either in person or remotely, as reported by credible sources.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Will Hurd must be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. The selection is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.body:

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

not_P.title: Will Biden not drop out before July 20?

question.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as **No** if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in these eight team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: 

- association football 
- 3×3 basketball
- 5×5 basketball
- field hockey
- handball 
- rugby sevens
- volleyball
- water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

The question can resolve as soon as it becomes clear one of these conditions will happen (e.g. neither team playing the final of the last event has won any of the others).

The outcome (Q) is that an athlete wins at least two medals in tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

Resolution: If the condition is met, resolve **Yes** if the outcome is true; resolve **No** if the outcome is false. If the condition is not met, resolve as N/A.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

not_P.title: Will Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker does not ask Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed unable to fulfill his presidential duties under the 25th Amendment Section 4 prior to August?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another pertinent authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially announce that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and enable the Vice President to act as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry.

Biden's departure from the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's own invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also not included.

Context: A GOP lawmaker requests Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the presidency.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024 that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept the nomination from his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the upcoming 2024 election.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: If Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will he be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment before August?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. The statement is unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

Then, is it true that before August 2024 (Eastern time), the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President?

Note: The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

not_P.title: If Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will he not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment before August?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. The statement is unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

Then, is it true that before August 2024 (Eastern time), the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President?

Note: The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

para_P.title: Should Biden state that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination, will he be deemed incapacitated under the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
Imagine the following scenario: Before midnight Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official declaration that he will not run for and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement is clear and definitive, leaving no possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

In that case, is it accurate to say that before August 2024 (Eastern time), the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant authority) will invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allow the Vice President to act as President temporarily?

Note: The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry. Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden activating section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

question.title: If Joe Biden does not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will he be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden does not make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. This means there is no unambiguous and conclusive statement leaving room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

Then, will the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time)?

Note: The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

not_P.title: If Joe Biden does announce before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic nomination, will he not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden does make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will seek and accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. This means there is an unambiguous and conclusive statement leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the nomination.

Then, will the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time)?

Note: The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

para_P.title: In the event that Joe Biden fails to publicly declare his refusal of the Democratic nomination by July 15, 2024, will he be deemed incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Joe Biden does not provide a clear, public, official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not seek or accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the upcoming 2024 election cycle. This implies that there is no clear and definitive announcement, leaving open the possibility that Biden might still accept the nomination.

In that case, will the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) activate Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allow the Vice President to act as President before August 2024 (Eastern time)?

Note: The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry. Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., does not apply. Biden's use of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not applicable.

question.title: Will the Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) form a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).  If no such agreement is announced, this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will the Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) not form a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 30, 2024, no electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions). If such an agreement is announced, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Les Républicains and the National Rally collaborate politically for the 2024 legislative elections in France?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if an official electoral coalition or alliance between Les Républicains and the National Rally is declared before June 30, 2024, based on information from [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions). If no such coalition is confirmed, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will the Prime Minister of France belong to the Together coalition on July 30, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

not_P.title: Will the Prime Minister of France not belong to the Together coalition on July 30, 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

para_P.title: On July 30, 2024, will the Prime Minister of France be a member of the Together coalition?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, on July 30th at 12:00 Central European Time, the Prime Minister of France's party is identified as Together, based on reliable sources.

If such an agreement is announced, this question resolves as No.

para_P.title: If the Prime Minister of France is affiliated with the Together coalition on July 30, 2024, will the Republicans Party collaborate with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?

Criteria for determining the outcome: This will be classified as **Yes** if, prior to June 30, 2024, an official announcement of an electoral alliance or coalition between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and the National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the forthcoming French legislative election is made, according to trustworthy sources. If such an agreement is not declared, the resolution will be **No**.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
not_P.body:

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of fewer than 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democratic members from the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the proposal for an early nomination of Biden?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating efforts to voice their opposition to their party’s initiative to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than initially intended, claiming it suppresses the critical ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter drafted by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) has been shared and was obtained by POLITICO, marking the first public indication from Democrats following the weekend’s attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many within their ranks are significantly concerned about the trajectory of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman stated in an interview. He refrained from verifying the existence of a letter.

This market will resolve to YES if a public statement opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 Democratic House Members or Senators prior to the market closing at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this market resolves to NO.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Democrats not have a brokered convention in 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party does not require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is a brokered convention anticipated for the Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially select its nominee for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if a single ballot suffices, then this question will resolve as **No**.

Multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures would also be adequate to resolve this market to YES. If these conditions are not satisfied by market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Will Kamala's chances of victory rise in the upcoming week based on Nate Silver's model?

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will declare before July 15, 2024, that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that he will not pursue or accept the nomination from his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election.

For a **Yes** determination, the announcement must be clear-cut and definitive: it must eliminate any doubt regarding Biden's acceptance of the Democratic Party's nomination for the presidency in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a conclusive announcement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this inquiry will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Given Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This occurs if Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to this effect, leaving no room for the possibility of accepting the nomination.

Then, is it true that Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model? This resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is greater than 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

not_P.title: Given Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will Kamala Harris's odds of winning not increase according to Nate Silver's model?
not_P.body:

This occurs if Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to this effect, leaving no room for the possibility of accepting the nomination.

Then, is it true that Kamala Harris's odds of winning do not increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model? This resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is 46.6% or less on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

para_P.title: If Joe Biden declares he will not pursue the Democratic nomination, will the chances of Kamala Harris winning rise based on Nate Silver's analysis?
para_P.body:

This would happen if Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, official statement to this effect, eliminating any possibility of him accepting the nomination.

In that case, is it accurate to say that Kamala Harris's chances of winning will increase in the following week according to Nate Silver's analysis? This is considered YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. It is considered NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

question.title: Given Joe Biden does not announce he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination, will Kamala's odds of winning increase according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:

Given this, will Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: Resolves YES if Joe Biden or his campaign does not make such an announcement by the specified time. Resolves NO if such an announcement is made.
- For the outcome: Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

not_P.body:

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: Resolves YES if Joe Biden or his campaign makes such an announcement by the specified time. Resolves NO if such an announcement is not made.
- For the outcome: Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is ≤46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden refrains from declaring that he will not pursue the Democratic Party's nomination, will Kamala's chances of success rise according to Nate Silver's analysis?
para_P.body:

Given this scenario, will Kamala Harris's chances of winning improve over the upcoming week according to Nate Silver's analysis?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: Resolves YES if Joe Biden or his campaign does not issue such a statement by the specified deadline. Resolves NO if such a statement is issued.
- For the outcome: Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's analysis is >46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 3 but not exceeding 4 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies that Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, representing a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

question.title: Will Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Larry Elder not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Larry Elder is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. At least one other candidate must be selected to resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Conditional on Larry Elder being the Republican nominee, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This means that Larry Elder is the official Republican candidate chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of any other candidates or the eventual nominee on the election day.

Given this, we want to know if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election will be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024. This is determined by the value reported on 538's chart for July 15, 2024, accessed on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

Resolution criteria for the condition: Larry Elder must be selected as the Republican nominee by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: The polling average must show Trump leading Biden by more than 3 but not more than 4 points on July 15, 2024. If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

In light of this, we seek to determine if Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential race will surpass 3 and not go beyond 4 on July 15, 2024. This will be assessed according to the figure displayed on 538's chart for that date, which will be reviewed on July 17, 2024. A positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates a lead for Biden.

Criteria for validating the condition: Larry Elder must be appointed as the Republican nominee by the Republican National Convention's delegates.
Criteria for validating the outcome: The polling average must reflect Trump leading Biden by more than 3 but no more than 4 points on July 15, 2024. If the condition is unmet, the result is N/A.

question.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as No if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, voleyball and water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

not_P.body:
This question resolves as Yes if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, voleyball and water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must not have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **No**.

para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with No if women's teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC) achieve gold medals in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo.

In contrast, the same NOC must have claimed at least two of these competitions for the answer to be **Yes**.

question.title: Conditional on the same nation winning more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics, will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman?
question.body:
This question explores the relationship between two seemingly unrelated events:

1. The same nation winning more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics. This condition resolves as Yes if the same National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in at least two of the following eight team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. It resolves as No if women's teams from eight different NOCs win gold in these sports.

2. The 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee being a woman. This outcome resolves as Yes if the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election, and No if they select a male nominee.

Suppose the following is true: The same nation wins more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics. Then, will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a woman?

2. The selection of a woman as the Democratic Presidential Nominee for 2024. This result is Yes if the Democratic delegates choose a female candidate for the presidential election in 2024, and No if they opt for a male candidate.

Assuming the following holds true: A single nation secures victories in multiple women's team sports at the 2024 Olympics. Then, will the Democratic Party's nominee for President in 2024 be female?

not_P.title: Conditional on Tim Scott being the Republican nominee, will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This determination is based on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not the day of the 2024 US election itself. 

Given this condition, will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024? The polling average is as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

para_P.title: Assuming Tim Scott is the Republican candidate, will Trump have a lead over Biden that exceeds 2 but is at most 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
Let us consider the following scenario: Tim Scott is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This choice is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not on the day of the actual 2024 US election. 

Under this assumption, will Donald Trump’s advantage over Joe Biden in the 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election be more than 2 and at most 3 on July 15, 2024? The polling average is taken from the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates a lead for Biden.

question.title: Conditional on Tim Scott not being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Tim Scott is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This means any candidate other than Tim Scott is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as reported on July 15, 2024, will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3? 

Resolution criteria: 
- For the condition: Resolves YES if Tim Scott is not the nominee.
- For the outcome: Resolves YES if the reported lead is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on the specified date, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

not_P.title: Conditional on Tim Scott not being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Tim Scott is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This means any candidate other than Tim Scott is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as reported on July 15, 2024, will be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3? 

Resolution criteria: 
- For the condition: Resolves YES if Tim Scott is not the nominee.
- For the outcome: Resolves YES if the reported lead is less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on the specified date, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

para_P.title: Assuming Tim Scott does not become the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 3 on July 15, 2024, according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
Let’s consider the scenario where Tim Scott is not chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This implies that a different candidate is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

In this case, is it accurate to say that Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as of July 15, 2024, will be greater than 2 and at most 3? 

Criteria for resolution: 
- For the condition: Resolves YES if Tim Scott is not the nominee.
- For the outcome: Resolves YES if the reported margin is greater than 2 and at most 3 on the specified date, as retrieved by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a Trump lead.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

not_P.title: Will Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and do not cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker does not ask Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed unable to fulfill his presidential duties under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This question is answered with a YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other appropriate authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and appoint the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, or similar circumstances is not applicable. Biden's own invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also not applicable.

Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to implement the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

This market will resolve to “No” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will 538 indicate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is projected to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will conclude with a “No” if Donald Trump is forecasted to have a better chance of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. In the event that both candidates are shown to have equal probabilities, this market will resolve as 50-50.

The resolution will rely on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, accessible at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically using the data represented by the blue and red trend lines for the resolution date of this market. Any alterations in the methodology employed by FiveThirtyEight for its calculations will not affect the resolution of this market.

This market will finalize based on the data available for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is released. It is possible that this market will not resolve until the July 20 data is accessible. If there are no data points for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will conclude based on the closest earlier figures to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution pertains to the winning probabilities of each candidate expressed as a number out of 100, rounded to one decimal place (e.g., “Trump 57 out of 100”). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be factored into the resolution.

question.title: Given FiveThirtyEight projects Biden as the favorite on July 19, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden is projected as the favorite to win the US presidential election over Donald Trump according to FiveThirtyEight's election forecast for July 19, 2024. This means that Biden has a higher probability of winning than Trump according to FiveThirtyEight's blue and red trend lines for that date. If no data is available for July 19, the nearest previous figures will be used.

Then, is it true that before August 2024, the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office," thus causing the Vice President to serve as Acting President? This does not include Biden exiting the office by death, resignation, or invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment. The duration of incapacity does not matter for this question.

Then, is it true that before August 2024, the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office," thus causing the Vice President to serve as Acting President? This does not include Biden exiting the office by death, resignation, or invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment. The duration of incapacity does not matter for this question.

para_P.title: With FiveThirtyEight indicating Biden as the frontrunner on July 19, is it possible that Biden will be deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:

This suggests that Biden has a greater chance of victory compared to Trump based on FiveThirtyEight's blue and red trend lines for that date. If data for July 19 is unavailable, the closest previous data will be referenced.

Then, is it accurate to say that before August 2024, the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) will invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and duties of his office," thereby allowing the Vice President to act as President? This scenario excludes Biden leaving office due to death, resignation, or the application of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment. The length of incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

not_P.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain less than 3% among Manifold respondents?
not_P.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 does not exceed that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 < 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump runs against Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat, will he achieve a minimum of 3% more support from Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are available, both closing on July 6. One survey presents a hypothetical ballot featuring Joe Biden, while the other includes a generic Democrat.

Public sentiment surveys frequently indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat included in hypothetical scenarios is either leading or is within the margin of error. Do the Manifold participants reflect the broader population?

This market will conclude with a YES if Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that of the second poll by 3% or more when both polls are finalized.

To calculate Trump's vote percentage, the formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). A YES response is given if the result of the first poll's formula minus the second poll's formula is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer will be NO.

The polls and this inquiry will not resolve to N/A and will stay open until the specified closing time regardless of circumstances.

question.title: If Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: In two Manifold polls closing on July 6, Donald Trump gains at least 3% when facing Joe Biden compared to a generic Democrat. Specifically, the percentage of votes for Trump in the poll with Joe Biden exceeds that in the poll with a generic Democrat by 3% or more. 

Resolution criteria for P: The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for the poll with Joe Biden - the formula for the poll with a generic Democrat >= 0.03.

Then, is it true that a member of the Trump family will be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?

Resolution criteria for Q: Resolves YES if one of the following individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, Barron Trump. Otherwise, it resolves NO.

question.title: Will Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Larry Elder not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Larry Elder is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Larry Elder going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if Larry Elder is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be marked as **No**. This question is open to other candidates that might be introduced later on.

For the purposes of this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; it is only based on who is appointed by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will Albania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Albania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. The question will resolve as **No** for all other outcomes regarding Albania.

not_P.title: Will Albania not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Albania does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. The question will resolve as **No** for all other outcomes regarding Albania.

para_P.title: Is Albania set to make it to the Grand Final at Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Albania takes part in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. The outcome will be **No** for any other scenarios concerning Albania.

question.title: Will Iceland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If not, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Iceland not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Iceland does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If so, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Iceland set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Iceland takes part in a Semi-final and is formally declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Otherwise, it will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Iceland qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Albania also qualify?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Albania participate in a Semi-final and also be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final? The question resolves as **Yes** if both conditions are met. If Iceland does not qualify, the question resolves as N/A. If Iceland qualifies but Albania does not, the question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Conditional on Iceland qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Albania not qualify?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Albania participate in a Semi-final and also be officially announced by the EBU as having not qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final? The question resolves as **Yes** if both conditions are met. If Iceland does not qualify, the question resolves as N/A. If Iceland qualifies but Albania does qualify, the question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: If Iceland secures a spot in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024, will Albania achieve qualification as well?
para_P.body: Assuming the following is accurate: Iceland competes in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Under these circumstances, will Albania also compete in a Semi-final and be confirmed by the EBU as qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final? The answer is **Yes** if both scenarios occur. If Iceland does not qualify, the answer is N/A. If Iceland qualifies but Albania does not, the answer is **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Iceland failing to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Albania qualify?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Albania participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?

not_P.title: Conditional on Iceland failing to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Albania not qualify?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Albania participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?

para_P.title: If Iceland does not make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Albania advance?
para_P.body: Assuming the following scenario is accurate: Iceland competes in a Semi-final and the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) officially declares that it has not qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. In that case, will Albania compete in a Semi-final and be officially declared by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating to voice their opposition to their party’s initiative to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than initially intended, as they contend it suppresses the vigorous ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, according to a legislator involved in the movement.

A letter in draft form, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, represents the first public indication from Democrats following the recent assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump that many of their colleagues are significantly concerned about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really poor decision by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a smart approach to limit debate and perhaps force unity, but that’s not how it operates,” Huffman stated in an interview. He chose not to verify the existence of the letter.

This market will conclude with a YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination strategy is signed by at least 20 Democratic House Members or Senators before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Additionally, if multiple letters collectively bearing 20 lawmakers' signatures are produced, this market will also resolve to YES. 

Should these conditions not be satisfied by market close, this market will settle as NO.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be 2 or less, or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump surpasses Biden be more than 2 but at most 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the difference in favor of Donald Trump over Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates Trump's advantage, while a negative figure signifies Biden's lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.
