para_P.title: Will 538 identify Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is projected to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will result in a “No” if Donald Trump is forecasted to have a higher likelihood of winning the US presidential election compared to Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the same date. In the event that both candidates have equal probabilities, the outcome will be a 50-50 resolution.

The source for resolution will be the FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, accessible at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, particularly the figures represented by the blue and red trend lines on the date of resolution for this market. Any alterations in the methodology employed by FiveThirtyEight to determine its statistics will not affect the outcome of this market.

This market will finalize based on the data for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is released. It may remain unresolved until the data for July 20 is available. If the July 19 data is not accessible by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve based on the most recent data prior to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution pertains to the winning probabilities of each candidate expressed as a number out of 100 rounded to one decimal place (e.g., "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be taken into account.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but at most 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In the context of this question, a positive number indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative number signifies that Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the figure recorded for that date shows Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would count as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is between 2 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, will 538 project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 points according to 538's national polling average. 

Resolution criteria for this condition: This is based on the value reported by 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Then, is the following true? On July 19, 2024, Joe Biden is projected as the favorite to win the US presidential election according to FiveThirtyEight's election forecast.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. If Trump is favored, it resolves to “No.” If the odds are equal, it resolves 50-50. The resolution is based on the odds reported by FiveThirtyEight, ignoring any changes in methodology.

not_P.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is between 2 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, will 538 not project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 points according to 538's national polling average. 

Resolution criteria for this condition: This is based on the value reported by 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Then, is the following true? On July 19, 2024, Joe Biden is not projected as the favorite to win the US presidential election according to FiveThirtyEight's election forecast.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves to “Yes” if Joe Biden does not have a higher probability of winning than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. If Trump is favored, it resolves to “No.” If the odds are equal, it resolves 50-50. The resolution is based on the odds reported by FiveThirtyEight, ignoring any changes in methodology.

para_P.title: With Trump's margin over Biden ranging from 2 to 4 points on July 15, 2024, will Biden be seen as the frontrunner on July 19, 2024 according to 538?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has a lead over Joe Biden that is more than 2 points but at most 4 points based on 538's national polling average. 

The criteria for determining this condition: This is derived from the data presented by 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure signifies a lead for Trump.

Now, is it accurate to say that on July 19, 2024, Joe Biden is forecasted to be the leading candidate for the US presidential election according to FiveThirtyEight's predictions? 

The criteria for the outcome: This will be considered “Yes” if Joe Biden is assigned a greater chance of winning than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight predictions for July 19, 2024. If Trump is projected to win, it will be “No.” If the probabilities are the same, it will resolve to 50-50. The resolution is based on the predictions from FiveThirtyEight, disregarding any methodological changes.

question.title: Conditional on Trump's lead over Biden being <= 2 or > 4 on July 15, 2024, will 538 project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average is either less than or equal to 2 points or greater than 4 points, as reported on the chart for that date. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

Then, on July 19, 2024, will Joe Biden have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast? This will resolve to “Yes” if Biden has a higher probability, “No” if Trump has a higher probability, or 50-50 if they have equal odds. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024.

not_P.body:

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

Then, on July 19, 2024, will Joe Biden not have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast? This will resolve to “Yes” if Trump has a higher probability, “No” if Biden has a higher probability, or 50-50 if they have equal odds. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024.

para_P.title: Given that Trump's advantage over Biden is either 2 points or fewer, or exceeds 4 points on July 15, 2024, will 538 indicate Biden as the frontrunner on July 19, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump is leading Joe Biden in 538's national polling average by either no more than 2 points or by more than 4 points, as shown in the chart for that date. In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies a lead for Biden.

On July 19, 2024, will Joe Biden be projected to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast? This will be answered with “Yes” if Biden's chances are higher, “No” if Trump's chances are higher, or 50-50 if their chances are equal. The resolution will be based on the FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the data represented by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024.

question.title: Will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has not testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump take the stand at the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, either in person or via remote means, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) regarding the alleged "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Iran military response before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

not_P.title: Iran military response not before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
not_P.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran does not initiate a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "No") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

para_P.title: Will there be a military action from Iran before midnight Eastern Time on August 13th?
para_P.body:
This market will be deemed "Yes" if Iran conducts a military operation on Israeli land, in its airspace, or within its maritime boundaries between July 30 and August 12, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET. If not, the market will conclude with a "No".

For this market's purposes, a "military operation" refers to any forceful action taken by Iran against Israeli land, airspace, or maritime boundaries (for instance, if an Iranian missile strikes a weapons depot in Israel, the market will be marked "Yes") that is officially recognized by the Iranian authorities or corroborated by a consensus of reliable reports. This encompasses, but is not limited to, aerial assaults, naval strikes, or ground invasions. Cyber warfare, sanctions, or diplomatic maneuvers will not be considered in this market's resolution.

Only actions taken by Iranian military forces that are explicitly acknowledged by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian soil, will be counted for the market's resolution. Attacks on Israel conducted by proxy groups (such as Hezbollah or the Houthis) will not be included in this market's resolution.

Cyber warfare, sanctions, or diplomatic measures do not qualify. 2. **Result**: Will Donald Trump provide testimony at the hush money trial? This is deemed a YES if reliable sources indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, whether in person or via remote means, at the trial regarding the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

If the first stipulation is satisfied: No Iranian military action occurs as defined. Then, is the second stipulation valid: Will Donald Trump provide testimony at the hush money trial?

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

para_P.title: Could Donald Trump face removal or disqualification from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position as per Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or disqualified from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The confirmation of removal or disqualification must come from official announcements by state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable media sources. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be sufficient for resolution.

The inquiry will be considered "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may happen *after* the specified date. It solely addresses whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then later reinstated, resulting in him not being removed or blocked from any ballot as of July 15, the question will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will Fidesz-KDNP Maintain Its EU Plurality from Hungary in 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if, following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources.

not_P.title: Will Fidesz-KDNP Not Maintain Its EU Plurality from Hungary in 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if, following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance does not secure more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby failing to maintain the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources.

para_P.title: Will Fidesz-KDNP Retain Its Majority Representation from Hungary in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a "Yes" if, after the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance obtains a greater number of seats than any other individual party or coalition, thus preserving the largest share of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, as per reliable sources.

question.title: Will the European Union announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

not_P.title: Will the European Union not announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has not announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

para_P.title: Is it possible that new tariffs or duties on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles will be declared by the European Union prior to July 5, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, reliable sources indicate that the European Union (EU) has made an announcement regarding the imposition of new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

question.title: Conditional on the EU announcing new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles, will Fidesz-KDNP maintain its EU plurality from Hungary in 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU. Then, following the 2024 European Parliament elections, will the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secure more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources?

not_P.title: Conditional on the EU announcing new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles, will Fidesz-KDNP not maintain its EU plurality from Hungary in 2024?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU. Then, following the 2024 European Parliament elections, will the Fidesz-KDNP alliance not secure more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby not maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources?

para_P.title: If the EU reveals new tariffs on electric vehicles from China, will Fidesz-KDNP continue to hold the most seats from Hungary in the 2024 elections?
para_P.body: Assuming the following is accurate: Prior to July 5, 2024, reliable sources indicate that the European Union (EU) has declared new tariffs or duties on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU. Then, after the 2024 European Parliament elections, will the Fidesz-KDNP coalition obtain a greater number of seats than any other individual party or coalition, thus preserving the largest representation of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to trustworthy sources?

question.title: Conditional on the EU not announcing new tariffs on Chinese EVs, will Fidesz-KDNP maintain its EU plurality from Hungary in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The European Union does not announce any new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024. This means there are no credible reports of such announcements. Then, is it true that Fidesz-KDNP will maintain its plurality in the European Parliament from Hungary in 2024?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: Resolves Yes if, before July 5, 2024, there are no credible reports of the EU announcing new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles.
- For the outcome: Resolves Yes if, after the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thus maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament according to credible sources.

not_P.title: Conditional on the EU announcing new tariffs on Chinese EVs, will Fidesz-KDNP not maintain its EU plurality from Hungary in 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: The European Union announces new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024. This means there are credible reports of such announcements. Then, is it true that Fidesz-KDNP will not maintain its plurality in the European Parliament from Hungary in 2024?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: Resolves Yes if, before July 5, 2024, there are credible reports of the EU announcing new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles.
- For the outcome: Resolves Yes if, after the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance does not secure more seats than any other single party or coalition, thus not maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament according to credible sources.

para_P.title: Assuming that the EU refrains from introducing new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles, will Fidesz-KDNP retain its leading position in the European Parliament from Hungary in 2024?
para_P.body:
Let us consider this scenario: The European Union does not implement any new tariffs or fees on the import of Chinese electric vehicles prior to July 5, 2024. This implies that there are no reliable reports of such tariff announcements. Under these circumstances, is it accurate to say that Fidesz-KDNP will keep its leading status in the European Parliament representing Hungary in 2024?

Criteria for resolution:
- Regarding the condition: Resolves Yes if, before July 5, 2024, there are no reliable reports indicating the EU's announcement of new tariffs or fees on imports of Chinese electric vehicles.
- Regarding the outcome: Resolves Yes if, following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance obtains a greater number of seats than any other individual party or coalition, thereby maintaining the largest share of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament according to credible sources.

question.title: Will Poland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Poland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Poland not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Poland does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Poland qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Poland going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Poland competes in a Semi-final and is formally declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Poland fails to qualify, the inquiry will be deemed **No**.

question.title: Will Denmark qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Denmark participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Denmark does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Denmark not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Denmark does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Denmark qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Denmark set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Denmark takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Denmark fails to qualify, the inquiry will be deemed **No**.

question.title: Given Denmark qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Poland also qualify?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, given that Denmark has qualified. If Poland does not qualify, the question resolves as **No**. If Denmark does not qualify, the question resolves as N/A.

not_P.title: Given Denmark qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Poland not qualify?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if Poland does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, given that Denmark has qualified. If Poland qualifies, the question resolves as **No**. If Denmark does not qualify, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If Denmark secures a spot in the Grand Final for Eurovision 2024, will Poland also make it through?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Poland takes part in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having made it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, provided that Denmark has qualified. Should Poland fail to qualify, the answer will be **No**. If Denmark does not qualify, the answer will be N/A.

question.title: Given Denmark fails to qualify, will Poland qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Denmark participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Poland participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?

not_P.title: Given Denmark fails to qualify, will Poland not qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: Denmark participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Poland participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?

para_P.title: If Denmark does not make it, can Poland secure a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?
para_P.body: Assuming this scenario holds: Denmark takes part in a Semi-final and is declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not qualifying for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. In that case, will Poland take part in a Semi-final and be declared by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

not_P.title: Will Biden not drop out before July 20?
not_P.body: If Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Biden will withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body: Should Biden withdraw or be otherwise incapacitated from continuing his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will conclude with a yes. If he does not, then the market will conclude with a no.

question.title: Will Mike Pence be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Mike Pence not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Mike Pence is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Mike Pence going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 Presidential Election in the United States?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Mike Pence is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the candidate for the 2024 Presidential Election in the United States. Any other candidates will be deemed **No**. This question is open to the possibility of additional candidates being included in the future beyond those currently listed.

For the purposes of this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the date of the 2024 election; the outcome is strictly based on the selection made by the delegates at the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Given Mike Pence is the Republican nominee, will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

Then, is it true that Joe Biden will drop out or be otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time? If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before this time, the resolution is yes. Otherwise, the resolution is no.

not_P.title: Given Mike Pence is the Republican nominee, will Biden not drop out before July 20?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

Then, is it true that Joe Biden will not drop out and will be able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time? If Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race before this time, the resolution is yes. Otherwise, the resolution is no.

para_P.title: If Mike Pence becomes the Republican nominee, will Biden withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: Mike Pence is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, a decision made solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who is nominated on the day of the 2024 US election.

Then, can we say that Joe Biden will withdraw or be otherwise unable to continue his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20? If Biden does withdraw or is otherwise unable to continue before this deadline, the answer is yes. If not, the answer is no.

question.title: Conditional on Mike Pence not being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body:
This question explores the scenario where Mike Pence is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any candidate other than Mike Pence is selected, this condition is met. 

The question then asks whether, given this scenario, President Biden will drop out or be otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, midnight Eastern Time.

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if Mike Pence is not the Republican nominee.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Biden drops out before July 20, otherwise resolves NO.
If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

not_P.title: Conditional on Mike Pence being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Biden not drop out before July 20?
not_P.body:
This question explores the scenario where Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If Mike Pence is selected, this condition is met. 

The question then asks whether, given this scenario, President Biden will not drop out or be otherwise able to continue the race before July 20, midnight Eastern Time.

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if Mike Pence is the Republican nominee.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Biden does not drop out before July 20, otherwise resolves NO.
If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

para_P.title: Assuming Mike Pence is not the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Biden withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body:
This inquiry considers the situation in which Mike Pence is not chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other individual besides Mike Pence is nominated, this premise holds. 

The question then inquires whether, in light of this situation, President Biden will exit the race or be otherwise unable to proceed before July 20, midnight Eastern Time.

Criteria for resolving the condition: Resolves YES if Mike Pence is not the Republican candidate. 
Criteria for resolving the outcome: Resolves YES if Biden withdraws before July 20, otherwise resolves NO. If the condition is unmet, resolves N/A.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

not_P.title: Conditional on Joe Biden announcing he will accept the Democratic nomination, will Will Hurd not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the nomination.

Given this, will Will Hurd not be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as Yes if Will Hurd is not chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as their nominee.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden publicly declares that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination, will Will Hurd become the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Assume the following scenario: Before midnight Eastern Time on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, and official statement that he will not run for or accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear-cut and definitive, allowing no possibility for Biden to reconsider the nomination.

In light of this, will Will Hurd be chosen by the Republican National Convention as their candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This will be answered with Yes if Will Hurd is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as their candidate.

question.title: Given Joe Biden does not announce he will not accept the Democratic nomination by July 15, 2024, will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden does not make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. This leaves open the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

Resolution criteria for this condition: Resolves Yes if no such announcement is made by the deadline, and No if such an announcement is made.

Now, given this condition, will Will Hurd be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question resolves as Yes if Will Hurd is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee, and No otherwise. The resolution is solely determined by the selection at the Republican National Convention.

not_P.title: Given Joe Biden does announce he will accept the Democratic nomination by July 15, 2024, will Will Hurd not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden does make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will seek and will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. This eliminates the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

Resolution criteria for this condition: Resolves Yes if such an announcement is made by the deadline, and No if no such announcement is made.

Now, given this condition, will Will Hurd not be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question resolves as Yes if Will Hurd is not chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee, and No otherwise. The resolution is solely determined by the selection at the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden does not declare by July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will Will Hurd be the chosen Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Joe Biden does not make a clear, public, official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not pursue or accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the upcoming election cycle. This scenario maintains the possibility that Biden might still accept the nomination.

Criteria for resolution: Resolves as Yes if no such declaration is made by the specified deadline, and No if such a declaration occurs.

In light of this condition, will Will Hurd be nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question resolves as Yes if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention delegates as the nominee, and No otherwise. The outcome is determined exclusively by the decision made at the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be 2 or less or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 3, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will resolve based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as indicated on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies a lead for Biden. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would count as a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

question.title: Will Disney announce a new Moana ride for Magic Kingdon at D23 2024?
question.body: This will resolve YES if Disney announces a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. It will resolve NO if it is discussed in a "spitballing ideas" sense similar to the way that some attractions were discussed at the previous D23. It will resolve NO if a Moana ride is announced for a different theme park in Florida or elsewhere. Betting closes on August 8, the day before the convention. It will be resolved after the convention.

not_P.title: Will Disney not announce a new Moana ride for Magic Kingdom at D23 2024?
not_P.body: This will resolve YES if Disney does not announce a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. It will resolve NO if it is discussed in a "spitballing ideas" sense similar to the way that some attractions were discussed at the previous D23. It will resolve NO if a Moana ride is announced for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida or elsewhere. Betting closes on August 8, the day before the convention. It will be resolved after the convention.

para_P.title: Will there be an announcement regarding a new Moana attraction for Magic Kingdom during D23 2024?
para_P.body: This will be considered a YES if Disney reveals a new Moana-themed attraction for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or prior to the D23 event in August 2024. It will be marked as NO if it is mentioned in a casual brainstorming context similar to how certain attractions were talked about in the last D23. It will also be NO if a Moana attraction is introduced for a different theme park in Florida or elsewhere. Betting will close on August 8, the day before the convention. The outcome will be determined after the convention.

question.title: Will Deadpool & Wolverine have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie? [ahead of Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
question.body:
Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

"""

[image]The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will the new movie top these marks? It will probably be close...

It will certainly play at more theaters... Deadpool was a smash hit at the time, and a bit surprising.

Since BoxOfficeMojo is a bit weird on reporting international opening weekends -- it provides the raw numbers but aggregates them weirdly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to let us know what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend

not_P.body:

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses less than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is <=$284.5M internationally... this weekend

To clarify on resolution...

-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or a similar publication) confirms it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words, the BoxOfficeMojo figures should be regarded as unofficial until there is validation in the Hollywood press. The target number we are aiming for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend.

question.title: Given Deadpool & Wolverine has the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie, will Disney announce a new Moana ride for Magic Kingdom at D23 2024?
question.body:
Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds. It is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend, potentially marking the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. The record to beat is the original Deadpool at $284.5M globally.

Resolution criteria for P: This resolves YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports, AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) confirms it as the record for an R-rated movie release.

Resolution criteria for Q: This will resolve YES if Disney announces a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. It resolves NO if it is discussed in a "spitballing ideas" sense, or if a Moana ride is announced for a different theme park.

It is anticipated to generate between $340 million and $360 million worldwide in its debut weekend, which could set a new record for R-rated films. The current record is held by the original Deadpool at $284.5 million globally.

Resolution criteria for P: This will resolve as YES if Deadpool x Wolverine exceeds $284.5 million globally during its opening weekend based on reports, AND the Hollywood Reporter (or a similar outlet) verifies it as the new record for R-rated movie releases.

Resolution criteria for Q: This will resolve as YES if Disney announces a new Moana-themed attraction for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or prior to the D23 convention in August 2024. It resolves as NO if it is merely a discussion of ideas, or if a Moana ride is introduced at another theme park.

question.title: Conditional on Deadpool & Wolverine NOT having the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie, will Disney announce a new Moana ride for Magic Kingdom at D23 2024?
question.body:
Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

Will the new movie top these marks? It will probably be close...

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses $284.5M or less globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> OR the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) does NOT report it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is <=$284.5M internationally... this weekend.

Suppose the following is true: Deadpool & Wolverine does NOT have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Then, will Disney announce a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024?

This will resolve YES if Disney announces a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. It will resolve NO if it is discussed in a "spitballing ideas" sense similar to the way that some attractions were discussed at the previous D23. It will resolve NO if a Moana ride is announced for a different theme park in Florida or elsewhere. Betting closes on August 8, the day before the convention. It will be resolved after the convention.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

para_P.body:

Directed by Shawn Levy and featuring Ryan Reynolds, the movie is anticipated to generate between $340 million and $360 million worldwide in its opening weekend. This would set a record for the largest opening weekend for an R-rated film. In the domestic market, it is expected to earn $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening in history.

If we assume that Deadpool & Wolverine does NOT record the largest opening weekend ever for an R-rated film, will Disney announce a new Moana-themed attraction for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024?

This will resolve YES if Disney announces a new Moana-themed attraction for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. It will also resolve NO if a Moana attraction is announced for another theme park in Florida or elsewhere. Betting closes on August 8, the day prior to the convention. If the condition is not fulfilled, it will resolve as N/A.

question.title: Will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

not_P.title: Will Greens–EFA not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **No**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will the Greens–EFA faction secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Greens–EFA faction achieves the highest seat count after the 2024 European Parliament elections, and with **No** for all other scenarios. In the event of a tie between two factions for the number of seats, both sub-questions will be answered with **Yes**.

The resolution of this question will depend on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media sources.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

not_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT not be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
not_P.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is not generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) question.title: Will "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%? ("Certified Fresh")
question.body:
"Twisters" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page

This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 75% or higher, one week after release (July 26th). 

Details 

I will use whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).

For example, the original "Twister" (1996) currently has a Tomatometer of 63%. This is the equivalent score I will use.

"Certified Fresh" is just used for illustrative purposes (AFAIK, it requires >=75% Tomatometer, but there might be other restrictions—the market resolves solely based on the displayed score).

"Twisters" (2024) is a standalone sequel to the 1996 original, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), starring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will there be no group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
not_P.body:
Politico reports:

Behind the scenes, things are even more calm. There are no drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and none would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if there is no group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators working together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by not signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group not speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that no five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is sufficient for a NO resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving YES. 

If these criteria are met before July 20th, this market resolves YES.

This market will conclude with a YES if at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or Senators collaborate to request Joe Biden to contemplate withdrawing from his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could occur through signing a letter as mentioned above, or through another method, such as a group meeting with Biden in person to collectively ask him to withdraw.

It is essential that all five individuals are part of the same collective message. If five individuals independently express to reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw, this will not suffice for a YES outcome.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats requesting Biden to resign will not meet the criteria of this market unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed before the market's closing date. In any ambiguous situations where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will tend to resolve NO.

If these conditions are not fulfilled before July 20th, this market will resolve NO.

Assuming the following holds true: A coalition of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or Senators urges Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign prior to July 20th. Then, will Trump's vote share in a Manifold poll against Biden surpass that against a generic Democrat by at least 3%? 

There are two Manifold polls available, both closing on July 6. One poll asks participants to vote for Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks for votes for a generic Democrat on a similar ballot.

This market will conclude with a YES if Trump's vote percentage in the first poll is 3% or more higher than in the second poll once both polls have closed.

The calculation for Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The result is YES if the difference between the calculation for poll 1 and poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

In this context, a positive figure denotes a Trump advantage, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for this question.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the gap between Trump and Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 4 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the difference in favor of Donald Trump over Joe Biden as indicated in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, resulting in a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

Criteria for determining the outcome: This will be marked as YES if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential race is greater than 2 and at most 4 points on July 15, 2024. The figure will be evaluated by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure signifies a lead for Trump.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
not_P.body:
Context from Politico:

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of fewer than 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Are 20 or more Democrats from the House or Senate going to endorse a public letter against the initiative to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party's move to finalize President Joe Biden's nomination sooner than initially intended, claiming it suppresses the vigorous ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, as stated by a lawmaker involved in this initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, serves as the first public indication from Democrats following the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their members are still quite concerned about the trajectory of Biden's candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a smart tactic to stifle debate and, by sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t function that way,” Huffman remarked in an interview. He did not confirm whether the letter exists.

This market will resolve to YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination initiative is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who align with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st.

Additionally, multiple letters totaling 20 lawmakers' signatures would also suffice to resolve this market to YES.

If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will an athlete win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

not_P.title: Will an athlete not win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if no athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

para_P.title: Is it possible for a tennis player to secure multiple medals at the 2024 Olympic Games in Paris?
para_P.body: This question will be answered as **Yes** if any tennis player achieves a minimum of two medals during the 2024 Olympic Games in Paris.

question.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win ≥21 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No". 

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

not_P.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win <21 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
not_P.body:

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won less than 21 gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

para_P.body:
