The official medal count provided by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other reliable sources will be used for resolution if the IOC's reporting is not available. If not, the market will be determined as "No". 

Should it be confirmed that Individual Neutral Athletes have secured 21 or more gold medals before the conclusion of the Games, the market will instantly resolve to "Yes".

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 4 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:

In the context of this question, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for this question.

question.title: If Joe Biden is not president by the end of July, will Trump's lead over Biden be between 2 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?

For instance, a figure of 2.4 would indicate that Trump is ahead of Biden by 2.4 points.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

If Biden engages in another in-person interview for a minimum of 45 minutes, this market will resolve in the affirmative. Conversely, if no qualifying interview is published before the market closes at the end of July, it will resolve negatively. 

This market excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It may include guest appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or an interview that is part of a program like 60 Minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to qualify. A 50-minute video might only showcase 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, which would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his guest spot on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous appearances on 60 Minutes have all contained less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden be more than 3 but not exceeding 4 according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the difference in favor of Donald Trump over Joe Biden as reflected in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In the context of this question, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, will Joe Biden have an in-person interview on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, as reported by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this condition, a positive value means a Trump lead.

Now, given this condition, will Joe Biden have an in-person interview or conversation on camera lasting at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Biden appears in an in-person interview/conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This includes appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. It does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, or town halls. If no such qualifying interview is released before the end of July, this resolves NO.

not_P.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, will Joe Biden not have an in-person interview on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, as reported by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this condition, a positive value means a Trump lead.

Now, given this condition, will Joe Biden not have an in-person interview or conversation on camera lasting at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Biden does not appear in an in-person interview/conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This includes appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. It does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, or town halls. If such a qualifying interview is released before the end of July, this resolves NO.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump's margin over Biden is more than 3 but not exceeding 4 on July 15, 2024, will Joe Biden conduct a 45-minute or longer in-person televised interview before July 31, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in the national polling average from 538 for the 2024 presidential election is more than 3 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, as reported by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive margin indicates Trump is leading.

Given this scenario, will Joe Biden engage in an in-person televised interview or discussion that lasts at least 45 minutes prior to the end of July 2024?

Criteria for determining the outcome: Resolves YES if Biden participates in an in-person interview/discussion on camera for a minimum of 45 minutes before the conclusion of July 2024. This includes appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or segments edited into programs like 60 Minutes, as long as there is at least 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden in an in-person interview. It excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, or town halls. If no qualifying interview is made public before the end of July, this resolves to NO.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is <= 3 or > 4 on July 15, 2024, will Biden have a 45+ minute in-person interview by end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose Trump's lead over Biden is either less than or equal to 3 points, or greater than 4 points, according to 538's national polling average on July 15, 2024. This is determined by the chart accessed on July 17, 2024, where a positive value indicates Trump's lead and a negative value indicates Biden's lead.

Given this condition, will Joe Biden have an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024? 

For the interview to qualify, it must not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast, late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. For context, interviews like Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he answered questions for ~70 minutes, qualify. If no such interview is released by the end of July, the question resolves NO.

not_P.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is > 3 and <= 4 on July 15, 2024, will Biden not have a 45+ minute in-person interview by end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose Trump's lead over Biden is either greater than 3 points, or less than or equal to 4 points, according to 538's national polling average on July 15, 2024. This is determined by the chart accessed on July 17, 2024, where a positive value indicates Trump's lead and a negative value indicates Biden's lead.

Given this condition, will Joe Biden not have an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024? 

For the interview to qualify, it must not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast, late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. For context, interviews like Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he answered questions for ~70 minutes, qualify. If no such interview is released by the end of July, the question resolves YES.

para_P.title: If Trump's advantage over Biden is at most 3 or exceeds 4 on July 15, 2024, will Biden participate in a 45-minute or longer face-to-face interview by the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming that Trump's advantage over Biden is either 3 points or fewer, or more than 4 points, based on 538's national polling average as of July 15, 2024. This will be verified through the chart reviewed on July 17, 2024, where a positive figure signifies Trump's advantage and a negative figure signifies Biden's advantage.

Under these circumstances, will Joe Biden engage in a direct interview or on-camera discussion lasting a minimum of 45 minutes before the end of July 2024? 

To be considered valid, the interview must exclude press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, and similar events. It may include guest appearances on podcasts, late-night talk shows, or segments edited into programs like 60 Minutes, as long as there is at least 45 minutes of fresh footage featuring Biden being interviewed in person. For illustration, Biden's participation on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to questions for approximately 70 minutes, would qualify. If no such interview is made public by the end of July, the outcome will be NO.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

not_P.title: Will Biden not remain President through the end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he remains President through the end of July 2024.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a NO resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Is it possible for Biden to stay in office until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if Biden continues as the US President until the end of July 2024 (ET); it will be a NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that time.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as the Acting President) does not lead to a YES outcome. (The Acting President is not the same as the President according to the Constitution)

question.title: Will Ron DeSantis be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

not_P.title: Will Ron DeSantis not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is Ron DeSantis going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other contenders will result in a **No**. This inquiry is not limited to candidates currently mentioned; additional options may be introduced later.

For the purposes of this question, it does not matter who obtains the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. The decision is exclusively based on who is appointed by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: If Ron DeSantis is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Biden remain President through the end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, will Biden remain US President through the end of July 2024?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: Ron DeSantis needs to be selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.
- For the outcome: Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not cause a YES resolution.

not_P.title: If Ron DeSantis is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Biden not remain President through the end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, will Biden not remain US President through the end of July 2024?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: Ron DeSantis needs to be selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.
- For the outcome: Resolves YES if Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he remains President through the end of July 2024.

para_P.title: Should Ron DeSantis be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Biden continue to serve as President until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: Ron DeSantis is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Will Biden still hold the office of US President until the end of July 2024?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: Ron DeSantis must be chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election.
- For the outcome: Resolves YES if Biden remains in office as US President until the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise stops being President before that time. A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not result in a YES resolution.

question.title: Given Ron DeSantis is not the Republican nominee, will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
This question considers two conditions:

1. **Condition**: Ron DeSantis is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This resolves as TRUE if any candidate other than Ron DeSantis is selected as the Republican nominee.

2. **Outcome**: Resolves YES if Biden remains the US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). Resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Note that temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (making his VP the Acting President) does not affect the resolution.

Suppose the condition is true: Ron DeSantis is not the Republican nominee. Then, will the outcome also be true: Will Biden remain President through the end of July 2024?

not_P.title: Given Ron DeSantis is the Republican nominee, will Biden not remain President through end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
This question considers two conditions:

1. **Condition**: Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This resolves as TRUE if Ron DeSantis is selected as the Republican nominee.

2. **Outcome**: Resolves YES if Biden does not remain the US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). Resolves NO if he remains President through that time. Note that temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (making his VP the Acting President) does not affect the resolution.

Suppose the condition is true: Ron DeSantis is the Republican nominee. Then, will the outcome also be true: Will Biden not remain President through the end of July 2024?

para_P.title: If Ron DeSantis is not the Republican nominee, will Biden still be in office until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines two factors:

1. **Factor**: Ron DeSantis is not chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is considered TRUE if any candidate other than Ron DeSantis is appointed as the Republican nominee.

2. **Result**: Resolves to YES if Biden continues to hold the position of US President until the conclusion of July 2024 (ET). Resolves to NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date. It is important to note that a temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (which makes his Vice President the Acting President) does not influence the resolution.

Assuming the factor is true: Ron DeSantis is not the Republican nominee. Then, will the result also be true: Will Biden continue to be President until the end of July 2024?

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
not_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of fewer than 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democratic members from the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the proposal to nominate Biden early?
para_P.body:
Background from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to express their dissent regarding their party's initiative to expedite President Joe Biden's nomination, which they contend suppresses the vital ongoing discussions surrounding his candidacy, as stated by a legislator involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, serves as the initial public indication from Democrats since the recent assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump that many of their own members are still quite concerned about Biden’s candidacy moving forward.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman remarked in an interview. He refrained from confirming whether the letter exists.

This market will resolve to YES if a public statement opposing the early nomination strategy is endorsed by at least 20 members from the House or Senators who align with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Additionally, multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Democrats not have a brokered convention in 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires only one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is a brokered convention expected for the Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if just a single ballot suffices, then the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Given the Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
This question explores the relationship between two political events within the Democratic Party in the context of the 2024 US presidential election. 

Suppose the following is true: The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election, indicating a brokered convention.

Then, is the following also true? At least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate President Joe Biden earlier than originally planned, before the market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Resolution criteria: The first condition resolves as YES if a brokered convention occurs as described. The second condition resolves as YES if at least 20 signatures are collected on such a public letter before the specified deadline. If either condition is not met, the respective component resolves NO.

not_P.body:

Then, is the following also true? Fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party do not sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate President Joe Biden earlier than originally planned, before the market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Resolution criteria: The first condition resolves as YES if a brokered convention occurs as described. The second condition resolves as YES if fewer than 20 signatures are collected on such a public letter before the specified deadline. If either condition is not met, the respective component resolves NO.

para_P.title: If the Democrats hold a brokered convention in 2024, will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate publicly oppose the early virtual nomination of Biden?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the connection between two political occurrences within the Democratic Party regarding the 2024 US presidential election. 

Assuming the following is accurate: The Democratic Party needs multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election, which signifies a brokered convention.

Then, can we also assert that? At least 20 Democratic House Members or Senators will sign a public letter against the proposal to virtually nominate President Joe Biden sooner than initially scheduled, prior to the market closing on Sunday, July 21st. 

Resolution criteria: The first condition resolves as YES if a brokered convention takes place as outlined. The second condition resolves as YES if at least 20 signatures are obtained on such a public letter before the given deadline. If either condition fails to be satisfied, the respective component resolves NO.

question.title: Conditional on Democrats not having a brokered convention in 2024, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Democratic Party requires only one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election, thus not having a brokered convention. Then, is it true that at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party will sign a public letter opposing the plan to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st? 

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if only one round of voting is required in the Democratic Party's roll call ballot. Resolves NO if more than one ballot is required.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Resolves NO otherwise.

not_P.title: Conditional on Democrats having a brokered convention in 2024, will fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election, thus having a brokered convention. Then, is it true that fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party will sign a public letter opposing the plan to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st? 

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if more than one round of voting is required in the Democratic Party's roll call ballot. Resolves NO if only one ballot is required.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is not signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Assuming there is no brokered convention for the Democrats in 2024, will a minimum of 20 Democratic House or Senate members publicly oppose the initiative to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Let’s consider this scenario: The Democratic Party only needs a single voting round in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election, thereby avoiding a brokered convention. Under these circumstances, can we affirm that at least 20 Democratic House Members or Senators will publicly sign a letter against the plan to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination earlier than initially intended by the market close on Sunday, July 21st? 

Criteria for resolving the condition: Resolves to YES if the Democratic Party's roll call ballot necessitates just one voting round. Resolves to NO if multiple ballots are needed.

Criteria for resolving the outcome: Resolves to YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination initiative is endorsed by at least 20 House Members or Senators associated with the Democratic Party before market close on Sunday, July 21st. Resolves to NO in all other cases.

question.title: Will Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: [Short Fuse] Will the proxy advisor Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advise Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
question.body: The question will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: [Short Fuse] Will the proxy advisor Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advise Tesla shareholders to vote in favor of Elon Musk's $57 billion package AND the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
not_P.body: The question will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *in favor of* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting AND the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: [Short Fuse] Will the proxy advisory firm Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) recommend that Tesla shareholders oppose Elon Musk's $57 billion compensation package or the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) issues a statement that clearly advises Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's compensation package during the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting or against the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the board of directors. If not, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump Jr. going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other contenders will result in a **No** outcome. This question is not limited to the candidates currently being discussed; additional options may emerge in the future.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who obtains the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will the Boston Celtics win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:

It resolves as **No** for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not announce that he is either dropping out or resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden does not announce either that he is no longer running for re-election or that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare that he is withdrawing and stepping down from the presidency prior to the end of July?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden declares that he is ceasing his campaign for re-election and that he will be stepping down and not completing his current term. These declarations must occur before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, although he does not need to have formally resigned and vacated his position by then. A statement of his intention to do so is adequate to resolve this market.

If not, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

question.title: Conditional on USD being worth >= 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024, will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Market resolves according to USD/JPY close listed for August 9th, 2024 on Yahoo! Finance.

Suppose the following is true: USD is worth >= 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024. Then, will Joe Biden announce both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time? These announcements must occur before the end of July 2024, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office by then. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

If USD is not worth >= 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024, resolve N/A.

These announcements must occur before the end of July 2024, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office by then. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

In that case, will Joe Biden make an announcement that he is both ceasing his campaign for re-election and resigning from his current presidential term before the end of July 2024, according to Pacific Time? These declarations must take place prior to the conclusion of July 2024, although he does not need to have officially resigned and vacated his position by that time. A statement of his intention to resign is adequate to resolve this market.

If the USD is not valued at 145 JPY or more at the close on August 9th, 2024, the outcome will be N/A.

para_P.title: If the USD is valued at less than 145 JPY at the close on August 9th, 2024, will Joe Biden declare his intention to withdraw and step down before the end of July?
para_P.body: Assuming the following condition holds: On August 9th, 2024, the USD closes at a value below 145 JPY, as per the USD/JPY closing figures on Yahoo! Finance. Will Joe Biden make a public statement before July 31, 2024, in Pacific Time, indicating that he is ceasing his campaign for re-election and that he plans to resign from his position, thereby not finishing his current term? These statements must occur prior to the conclusion of July 2024, although he is not required to have officially resigned and vacated his office by that time. A declaration of his intention to do so will suffice.

question.title: Will Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

not_P.title: Will Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and do not cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker does not ask Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Will Biden be recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be affirmed with a YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also excluded.

Context: A GOP lawmaker requests Merrick Garland to use the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this condition.

We are interested in whether Nikki Haley will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This resolves as Yes if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as No. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

We are interested in whether Nikki Haley will not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This resolves as Yes if Nikki Haley is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as Yes if Nikki Haley is selected. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Before July 1, 2024, will the International Criminal Court issue arrest warrants for any of the listed Israeli leaders?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

not_P.title: Before July 1, 2024, will the International Criminal Court not issue arrest warrants for any of the listed Israeli leaders?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) does not issue a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

para_P.title: Will any of the specified Israeli leaders have arrest warrants issued by the International Criminal Court before July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if, prior to July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the Israeli cabinet members listed below. It will be answered with **No** in all other cases.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

question.title: Given the ICC issues arrest warrants for Israeli leaders, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a warrant of arrest for any of the listed Israeli leaders: Benjamin Netanyahu, Yoav Gallant, or Herzi Halevi. Then, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if the ICC issues a warrant of arrest for any of the listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024. Resolves NO otherwise.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President before August 2024. Resolves NO otherwise.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment does not count.

not_P.title: Given the ICC does not issue arrest warrants for Israeli leaders, will Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) does not issue a warrant of arrest for any of the listed Israeli leaders: Benjamin Netanyahu, Yoav Gallant, or Herzi Halevi. Then, will Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if the ICC does not issue a warrant of arrest for any of the listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024. Resolves NO otherwise.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and do not cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President before August 2024. Resolves NO otherwise.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment does not count.

para_P.title: If the ICC issues arrest warrants for leaders of Israel, will Biden be deemed unfit under the 25th Amendment?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Prior to July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues an arrest warrant for any of the mentioned Israeli officials: Benjamin Netanyahu, Yoav Gallant, or Herzi Halevi. Then, will Biden be deemed unfit under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024?

Criteria for evaluating the condition: Resolves YES if the ICC issues an arrest warrant for any of the mentioned Israeli officials before July 1, 2024. Resolves NO if not.

Criteria for determining the outcome: Resolves YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to declare that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President before August 2024. Resolves NO if not.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not included.

question.title: If the ICC does not issue arrest warrants for listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) does not issue a warrant of arrest for any of the following Israeli cabinet members: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff). Given this, will the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time)?

Assuming the following holds true: Before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) does not release an arrest warrant for any of these Israeli government officials: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff). In this scenario, will the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other appropriate authority) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allow the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time)?

Note: The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry. Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not considered. Biden utilizing Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not considered.

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

not_P.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" not be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is not higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

para_P.title: Will the domestic box office debut of "Deadpool & Wolverine" exceed the combined total of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine"?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if the domestic box office debut for **Deadpool & Wolverine** as reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is greater than $185,548,391, which is the total of the box office earnings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not announce that he is either dropping out or resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden does not announce either that he is no longer running for re-election or that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements not occurring before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is not sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare his intention to both withdraw from the election and step down from the presidency prior to July's conclusion?
para_P.body:
This resolves YES if Joe Biden declares that he is withdrawing from running for re-election and that he will be stepping down, thereby not finishing his current term. These declarations must occur before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, although he does not need to have formally resigned and left office by that time. A statement of his intention to do so is adequate to resolve this market.

If not, this market will resolve NO on August 1st.

question.title: Will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. At least one other candidate will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is not selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Will Hurd going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Will Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be considered as **No**. This question is open to the possibility of additional candidates being introduced in the future beyond those listed now.

For the purpose of this inquiry, it does not matter who holds the Republican nomination on the date of the 2024 US election; the outcome is exclusively based on who is nominated by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Will there be an in-person discussion or interview with Joe Biden lasting over 45 minutes captured on video before July 2024 concludes?
para_P.body:
The latest relevant interview occurred when Biden was on The Howard Stern Show in April, during which he responded to inquiries for approximately 70 minutes. 

If Biden participates in another in-person interview that lasts at least 45 minutes, this market will resolve to YES. Conversely, if no qualifying interview is made public before the market closes at the end of July, it will resolve to NO. 

This market does not consider press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraising events, town halls, etc. However, it may include podcast appearances or late-night show segments, or interviews that are part of a program like 60 Minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of fresh footage of Biden being interviewed in person. A 50-minute video could potentially contain only 20 minutes of Biden's interview footage, which would not qualify. 

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his segment on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous appearances on 60 Minutes have each featured less than 30 minutes of interview footage.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The lack of removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or barring must be substantiated by official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be resolved as "No" if these criteria are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may happen after the specified date. It strictly addresses whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the given grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and then later reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or barred from any ballot as of July 15th, the question will resolve negatively.

Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

para_P.title: Should Donald Trump be disqualified or prevented from appearing on a primary election ballot according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will Joe Biden conduct an on-camera interview lasting over 45 minutes prior to the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following scenario is accurate: Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. This disqualification or prevention is verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media coverage. This is confirmed by the absence of official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports indicating such removal or block. 

Then, is it true that Joe Biden will have an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024? This does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. There must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count.

para_P.title: Assuming Donald Trump remains eligible for all primary election ballots according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will Joe Biden participate in a face-to-face interview lasting over 45 minutes prior to the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Let us consider the following as accurate: By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (including President, Senate, or House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This is validated by the lack of official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable news reports suggesting any disqualification or barring. 

Under these conditions, can we affirm that Joe Biden will engage in an in-person interview or on-camera discussion that lasts at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024? This does not encompass press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but may include guest appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or an interview incorporated into a program such as 60 Minutes. There must be a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden being interviewed in person for such appearances to qualify.
